name: North Carolina Museum of Art
address: 2110 Blue Ridge Rd, Raleigh, NC 27607, USA
reviews: I love this place!!! It's beautiful! It's well taken care of and the art is amazing. There's lots of different cultures and eras to choose from when looking around. They've got some impressive artists and impressive works by artists you may not even know. They have a cool little coffee shop (super important, in my opinion) and they even have a restaurant! I haven't eaten there but I definitely plan on it, soon. Walking past it, I saw some people's plates and it looked great! I can't wait to go back!

Thoroughly enjoyed my visit and can't wait to go again. Excellent mix of contemporary and classical pieces. Each part of the exhibit is very unique and admission was free! We spent 3 hours easily and there was still more sculptures and portraiture to see. We are already planning our next visit. I would highly recommend it.

Beautiful and the sights were amazing! However I wish the art pieces were easier to walk to with direct trails leading to each piece. I understand the long trails for people who wanna run, bike or take their time. But for people like me and my boyfriend we just wanted to see the art outside and ended up missing alot of it because of time and weather. Other then that this place was awesome.

Great selection of art and artifacts ranging anywhere from 6,000 years old to a few years old. Plenty of indoor gallery space with a few very well known artists as well as a huge outdoor "grounds" with giant sculptures and other large installations. Excellent place to hang out and experience art from many different time periods and cultural movements.

So my boyfriend and I took a trip here for Valentine's Day. As we roamed the halls of the building with the permanent exhibition, we realized that there is literally like one or two art exhibitions on or about African Americans. There is nothing on Native Americans and nothing on Latinos. Which means the dominant narrative is one centered around white Europeans. The narrative and history being told by the items the NC Museum of Art chooses to show in its' permanent exhibition is only a portion of history and quiet frankly uplifts white supremacy. The NC Museum of Art can do better.

name: Pullen Park
address: 520 Ashe Ave, Raleigh, NC 27606, USA
reviews: Really nice place for families. They have rides, boats and trains for kids! Also this park is very close to Raleigh downtown where there’s a lot of good restaurants and cafes. Top choice for parents with kids 3-8 years old. The place will get much more prettier in spring when all flowers bloom.

A very nice place to visit. It's a small park, but really a cool place for parents to take their children,  or for parents to take their children. I was informed that during the summer, they're many picnics and concerts in that park, so I can't wait to visit during that time. The outdoor train was a really cool thing for kids. The Merry Go Round was especially nice as well. I can't wait to go back.

Such a wonderful park. Plenty of fantastic free fun for the family. The playgrounds are safe, clean, and modern. The snack bar is reasonable and the cost for the rides is very accessible at $1.50 per ticket and each ride requiring one ticket per person. I think the paddle boats may require a minimum of 4 tickets to ride.

This is an amazing park with a play area for children. It also has cover if its a sunny day so you can rest and get hydrated again. There is a train for family to have a over look of the park and for the children to enjoy the scenery. There is also a carousel for the children. Over all an amazing medium sized park to go with family and friends.

It was a fun little Park to go to.

My three-and-a-half-year-old sun absolutely loved the train and the boats!!!

Also nice that they have a free playground, but you can take a child to instead of spending money.

Bathrooms were in decent condition.

Overall I would definitely recommend this!

name: Marbles Kids Museum
address: 201 E Hargett St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: We love Marbles! For parents with young children, this museum is a gem. As other reviewers have mentioned, you and your kiddos could spend hours here and not be bored as there are several exhibits designed to ignite their curiosity. I love that Marbles emphasizes the importance of play and imagination for children. At many of their exhibits, you'll find that they translate concepts such as money/budgeting, customer service, weather, emergency personnel, into messages that young children can better understand. It does tend to get slammed on holidays and weeeknds as you can imagine, but despite that, because there is so much to do, you'll find that there is a good flow between the exhibits and how many children are in a location at once.

Love love love this place, especially when you have a 3 year old full of energy. You can spend whole day here and your kids will not be bored. From arts and craft area to toddler section everything is interesting. Would love to take my kids there again and again  and plus point is If you have a specific bank card (can’t remember the name ) on the first weekend of every month one admission will be free.

My 2 year old had so much fun there! You can easily spend 2-3 hours there. There is so much to do for the kids. I really loved it! It’s the perfect place for some indoor fun. We will be back next time we visit Raleigh for sure.

What a wonderful concept...learning while playing. My grandson is only 15 months, but now walking, he can explore different aspects of science and nature. It is a perfect museum for children to grow into. Lots to do for all ages. You can spend hours there, or like us, 1hr. Depends on the age of the child.  Luckily, the walk in person, myself, admission was only $7.+ tax. I bought my son, daughter in law and grandson a member ship for Christmas at $120. It jumped to $130 for the new year. Pretty steep for families trying to live. Then the next membership is $150. That gives you an opportunity to see other museums.
Parking can add up in the oarking garage also.

This is a wonderful place for children of all ages to explore and learn through play! It does get crowded so be mindful of peak times when planning a visit. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because some toys were not working or had missing parts. Additionally, some surface parts of the museum felt dirty and had grime built up that was visible.

name: North Carolina Museum of Natural Sciences
address: 11 W Jones St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: What a great experience. Today the 8 of us had a great time at the museum. The exhibitions were very well presented and interesting. Also the kids had an awesome time at the discovery laboratory and the interactive displays. I will recommend this place to everyone. People with or without kids. Lots of fun.

Great place for kids and nostalgic place for adults. It's free to get in and donation are always welcomed. There are 3 floors so make sure you have good walking shoes. The museum is handicap assessable. Staff to s very friendly and I was pleasantly surprised. Great for field trip, out of town guests, or a off day. I would say this is me te for the kids but adults are welcome too.

How is this FREE?! I've been here probably 10 times, and have loved it every time.  Good for people of all ages. My mom hates museums but loves this one.  They have so much cool, interactive stuff.  Plan to spend several hours here. You still won't see everything. This is probably my all-time favorite museum in the world.

A real nice place to go, especially for little to no money! (Donations are welcomed) I had a two year old and it was very informative and though she did not get to know a lot about the different exhibits, there was still a lot for her to interact with and see. Especially at the Discovery center.

This place was awesome! And its free?? We had to come up for a business trip and wanted to see Raleigh. When I saw this place, I thought it would be a great place to take my boys, I was totally right. My oldest (7) had the best time. They have experiments that children can do, they have displays about the science work that is going on. It. Was. Amazing! It's right across from the state Capitol. There was a history museum right next door. It's in walking distance from a lot of things, and there are bus stops close by if you need to go farther. . We loved it!

name: JC Raulston Arboretum
address: 4415 Beryl Rd, Raleigh, NC 27606, USA
reviews: We love this arboretum! They really pack so many beautiful trees, shrubs and flowers in a relatively small botanical garden. There are so many little trails through the gardens that you can really find some peace and quiet no matter how busy it is. It is well organized with a Japanese garden, a desert garden, and local favorites. There are also some nice fields to picnic or toss a ball around.

The best place for a stroll by yourself or with family. We love to bring out of town guests to explore the grounds, year round too! Everything is so well kept. Parking can be an issue during high volume times, just pay attention to street parking so you don't end up in a ticketed area. Beautiful spot for family pictures to prom to event rentals!

We met up with a friend here for the first time with our children from ages 2-10 and we all had an absolute blast! Great times and even better memories! Only forewarning I'd offer to parents with young children is to be cautious near the rear of the main building as they have a bunch of cacti and other sharp/pointy plants. The majority of the park is of little concern in comparison. We will certainly be returning again very soon.

Here's the thing: there is not a lot of color or  blooming going on at this time of year but there is plenty of life in the arboretum every day. There is room for kids to run and explore,  young couples to huddle in quiet corners, and everyone to spend quality time checking out all kinds of plants from all over the world that also thrive in our environment...and all of this on a holiday. We had a great time!

Excellent stop to walk and enjoy the beauty. We're visiting for the weekend and enjoyed the opportunity to get out into nature. The visit was free and the helpful volunteer at the Visitor's Center gave us a map with a tour of what was in bloom at the time of our visit.

name: Lake Johnson Park
address: 4601 Avent Ferry Rd, Raleigh, NC 27606, USA
reviews: So my girlfriend and I came down here on vacation from New York State. We were staying in Cary North Carolina and decided to come check out this park because it had some good reviews. This was a very beautiful Park and loved the hike around the lake. The boardwalk was really cool to walk and crossed and seen tons of wildlife was really cool as well. I definitely would recommend this place to other people

I love this place. Nice easy trails. It is always a little bit busy there and parking is usually packed but it is also very relaxing to spend time at this place. Good if you like exercising and enjoy nature. I also love that you can rent a boat or a kayak. It's a family friendly place.

Great hiking and you can choose a simple walk around the lake on blacktop or a longer hike via an extension that is mostly hiking trail. The blacktop around the lake can get a little crowded especially on weekends but still a very nice walk with a few steep hills and amazing views of the lake. Great family walking destination pretty much any time of year. Nice bathrooms and eating area are a plus.

Perfect loop options around this perfect lake. One 3 mile paved loop, and one 2 mile unpaved option. The kayak and boat rentals are awesome!! The only way to improve this lake is to allow those rentals for longer than just the Summer, please. We're in the South, it stays warm much longer than just 3 months.

We really enjoy the walking trail.   It is a nice 3 mile walk, with some change in elevation as well.   The main path is paved and about six feet wide, so it is easy for bicyclists to avoid walkers.   There is a wide variety of dogs, taking their humans for a walk.

name: Frankie's Fun Park
address: 11190 Fun Park Dr, Raleigh, NC 27617, USA
reviews: Lots of fun. The go carts are pretty fast, the place is clean and well kept. The employees are all very very nice. Most young employees don’t care about their job and can have attitude but I was pleasantly surprised here because they were all so sweet!

Fun place! Took my 15 year old here for his birthday party. Even played laser tag with all of them. Go karts, video games, food... This place is full of fun! The beer made it especially nice to relax while the kids ran around and played.

I was in North Carolina on a business trip. On my off day I got to visit this fun park. It was awesome. So many attractions. It felt like a mini theme park. I will definitely be visiting again next time I’m in the area.

I was more of a bystander, but I thoroughly enjoyed watching my grandson and daughter while they had a great time, especially on the go carts. I loved watching my grandson beat this older guy who thought he was going to race by him because he was younger, lol.
I'd give it 5 stars if the concession stand had a better food selection.

Had a lot of fun. There was stuff for the entire family to stay busy. Go karts are $8 for approximately 5 minutes, mini golf has 3 different courses and cost $9 per course. Laser tag is a team VS team mode cost $7 for a 5 minute game. There is a vr ride shooting game for $7 for 5 minutes which is a ton of fun. And then there is the arcade with some of the coolest games around. Me and my family spent 50 a piece and had fun for 5 to 6 hours.

name: Raleigh Brews Cruise
address: 9650 Strickland Rd #103, Raleigh, NC 27615, USA
reviews: We had an amazing time!  Booking a trip was super easy and the meeting spot was excellent!  Brews cruise allowed us to travel and try breweries that we probably never would have!  We all felt the price was beyond reasonable and we are already planning our next cruise!  Thanks to Tonya for being an amazing guide!!  Can't wait to do it again!

We had the pleasure of spending my mom’s 55th birthday with Raleigh brew crews. It was such a fun experience. If you are looking to explore local breweries, Tonya and Tim will help make for a memorable experience. I have nothing but great thing to say about this tour!!

Tanya and Chris were awesome! They took us to three brewery type places (we went to Raleigh Rum with Oak City Amaretto, Clouds Brewery Tap Room, and Brier Creek Beer Garden but they go to different places every trip). They have a bus with snacks and waters so you do not have to drive from place to place, and they took fantastic care of us! At each location they set us up with multiple samples and a short talk/tour from someone at the company then gave us time to order and try other things. It was $50 per person for us and we absolutely got our money's worth, we will definitely be back for another tour!

The Raleigh Brews Cruise is a wonderful and very fun activity that you do not want to miss!  The Owners are great and you can see how much they care about their business and their customers!   It is a treat to visit all these breweries (with transportation provided!), learn all about the beer making process and of course, enjoy some great beer!  I brought a group and they have said over and over again how much they loved it!

Make sure plan an outing with Raleigh Brews Cruise soon---you will have a great time!

Wow. What a fantastic afternoon -- in ways we didn't even expect! From the initial communication to the final goodbye, the Brews Cruise tour guides were knowledgable, helpful, personable...and FUN! They bent over backwards to make this a special experience for us: snacks, water, advice, fun conversation. They curated a perfect collection of breweries where we not only got to sample the beer but learn from the owners themselves about the process, the tasting notes and distinctive intricacies. Learning + laughter + beer = one heck of an afternoon. I'd highly recommend this, my friends.

name: North Carolina State Capitol
address: 1 E Edenton St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: One of the smaller state capitols we've visited but worth a trip. Many states have modernized or created new capitols but this building predates the Civil War and the ground floor is still used by the governor. A self-guided tour upstairs has exhibits on the building's history.  The state legislatures have moved two blocks North, just past the State History and Science Museums. That building also allows self-guided tours.

The Behind the Scenes tour is offered periodically and I would highly recommend. It's offered by the NC Dept of Natural and Cultural Resources. The tour guide was very enthusiastic, knowledgeable, and passionate about the tour which lends to a more entertaining and interesting experience. You do have to climb a lot of steps so be prepared with good shoes. The tour guide was very accommodating and was sure to let us know in advance of tight spaces and narrow climbs so you could opt out at parts of the tour. We had been on a regular tour some many years ago and this was by far so much better. We also had a good group of like minded history oriented people so that made it even better. We finished up with light snacks on the second floor portico overlooking the grounds.

The tour guide was very enthusiastic, knowledgeable, and passionate about the tour which lends to a more entertaining and interesting experience. You do have to climb a lot of steps so be prepared with good shoes. The tour guide was very accommodating and was sure to let us know in advance of tight spaces and narrow climbs so you could opt out at parts of the tour. We had been on a regular tour some many years ago and this was by far so much better. We also had a good group of like minded history oriented people so that made it even better. We finished up with light snacks on the second floor portico overlooking the grounds.

Actually a great place to visit.  Also in the winter, if you have the chance,  local Wake County High Schools Chorus' sing in the rotunda. The acoustics are incredible for this!  Should try to check it out.
The place is small, but has friendly staff with nice exhibits. Will be better once the renovations are done.

name: Neuse River Trail
address: Raleigh, NC 27610, USA
reviews: The family tool a bike ride and everyone enjoyed it. It is an easy ride, with plenty of scenery changes to keep the little ones interested. Keep in mind that there will be plenty of others on the trail and you have to me mindful of the other bodies. On that note, if you are looking for a quiet, tranquil patch of Greenway, this is most definitely not it.

So much beauty and comfort !! The sounds, the escape. Fitness in the beauty of the outdoors.

Great picnic site!

You can hike or swim. Though the current creates a sort of swimming treadmill.

Not to mention a FREE perk of NC!

Absolutely gorgeous walk! The paths are are easy to follow with path signs to point you in which ever adventure you want. Great for walking, biking, hiking, and fishing. I will definitely have to come back because the trails have a bit of length to it when walking. I'll be back for more!
Great trail - check it out!
Beautiful trail, well maintained. Hiking, running, bicycling or even wildlife viewing!

name: CAM Raleigh
address: 409 W Martin St, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews: Great space for events, showings in excellent downtown Raleigh location. Recently, I participated as a vendor at NC Book Festival Book Fair at CAM. Wish there had been more street side advertising for the event to increase foot traffic to support the authors and publishers at the book fair, but overall a nice experience in an accessible location.
Family Day at CAM, this was our first visit, my grandson loved it!! He sat on a Harley and said "awesome". The DJ, arts & crafts, and ice cream was a big hit. We're definitely coming back.

Interesting architecture and beautiful art line the walls, though it's a very small museum overall. We went for a free family event and it was awesome. We wandered around after the event and were impressed with the art pieces, but found that there's not much here among the three levels. This is similar to other modern art museums in comparable sized cities, so I guess it's just a function of population. The staff were amazing and friendly!
Enjoyed CAM Raleigh. Relaxed environment. Nice art and exhibits that celebrate culture as well different time periods. You could spend anywhere from 30 minutes to a few hours here and feel fulfilled.

Go see the Low Rider custom motorcycle exhibit 
You won't be disappointed 
And drop by Humble Pie across the street for eats n drinks while your there

name: Mordecai Historical Park
address: 1 Mimosa St, Raleigh, NC 27604, USA
reviews: We visited the Mordecai House on a cold fall day but it was nice and warm in the buildings. All of the on-site buildings are climate controlled and the tour for adults is $7 and of very good value. There are a few older buildings that have been moved to the site from around Raleigh including the birthplace of President Andrew Johnson. The tour guide was incredibly informed and went into detail about each building and the occupants. As history lovers, we greatly enjoyed this. Everyone on the tour enjoyed it as well. It was a decent sized group of people of all ages. We were informed they do living history events as well and we will be returning for that too. Something we especially enjoyed was the fact the furniture and the other items in the Mordecai Home are 98% original to the house which is not usual in historic homes. The visitor center had a very well put together museum section too and that was interesting. The whole thing makes for a very enjoyable time out.

I Stopped by on a Sunday and was pleased with the tour and how close together things were. The tour was very interesting. The house was a very neat historical home. It was also fun to walk around the outside of the house. If you are looking for something to do in Raleigh I would recommend this.

I've visited this spot twice to experience the Mojaa performing arts center " Escape to Freedom" reenactment. Tickets are about 12-15 pp. Families should definitely be apart and visit the indoor museum before or after the show. Great discussion piece.

We recently visited this historic house & park. Even though the day was hot & humid, the house & structures are cool & comfortable. Our guide, Marissa, was superb! She had a large group (our seniors as well as a family with small children, etc) and she made the presentation relatable to all, interesting, and fun. She really seems to enjoy what she does and it shows. She made history fun!
Fun day, learning new things about Raleigh. Tour guide was knowledgeable and friendly.

name: William B. Umstead State Park
address: 2100 N Harrison Ave, Cary, NC 27513, USA
reviews: Good place for walking and some picnic spots.  Nice Small lake with bridge into it. Can take nice pictures from there. There is a little park area where some are playing and relaxing. The trails are okay and have wet patches on the way. Not clean. This park can be improved more so can attract more visitors as it is in nice location. There restrooms and water stations.

What a great place to walk, hike, run, or just sit and enjoy nature. Great for all ages, clean well marked trails.

They need to open earlier and at the very least put the hours of operations at the gate, which is 8am.
Conveniently located. Great for a relaxed weekend hike. The trails are clean and well maintained. Dogs on leashes are allowed.
Beautiful park, lots of walking trails. Take your mobile or GPS with you; it's easy to get lost.

Great trails, only minutes from RDU and RTP. Since it's in the heart of the Triangle, lots of people use these the trails. If you want peace and quiet, there are other great natural places. Overall, a real gem!

name: City of Raleigh Museum
address: 220 Fayetteville St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: The City of Raleigh Museum in Raleigh is a cool museum that explores the history and highlights of the city. I liked all of the different displays that were very informative and educational and I was able to learn many things. Everything here is well organized and curated and I had a good time here. The museum has free admission and is well worth the visit to check it out. The building the museum is at is very cool too. Great experience and a lot of fun.
Beautiful ly well done with hands on exhibits.
Loved it... So much things and information that helped me learn more about NC and mainly about the rapidly growing city of Raleigh. Very nice museum to visit and spend some good time at.

Very nice museum, really nice staff and a good place to take your kids to learn more about history especially local history. I really enjoyed the concept of having temporary exhibits that change often and you get to learn new things.

What a fantastic little city gem! Right on the main street in Raleigh, NC, once you get inside, you'll be amazed by the space and the number of exhibits they were able to fit inside. Many areas feature rotating, temporary displays and admission is free so I'll keep coming back.

They also have diverse membership choices, the smallest at $35 gets you discounts to numerous small events they host during the year (an Oct. 'Dark Raleigh' tour, Raleigh Roast in Jan, etc, etc). That's an easy call to support such a great Raleigh institution!

name: Artspace
address: 201 E Davie St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: Beautiful art space with a wonderful range of artists! We were Downtown and wandered in after lunch and found this amazing gem....A Must See when in Raleigh!

The new installations in this space always bring a smile to my art loving face. We had the pleasure of getting to meet the artists of the main installations on First Friday, it was insightful and riveting. I would definitely recommend going and checking out the work these wonderful craftsmen have created. Don't be a square, Vicent Van GOOOO to Art Space.

Wish I had more time! Wandered through fewer than half the spaces and saw just a ton of fun, beautiful and inspirational work.  Had a lovely chat with two of the artists.  This was my alternative to visiting a museum in downtown and I’m really glad I did it.

I've been here many times either looking at their exhibitions or just walking through the different artist suites, admiring their work. The exhibitions they've had in their upstairs area have shown some varied pieces from many different artists, I even bought a piece from an exhibition they had a couple months ago. They also hold many cool events showcasing their artists in residence. It's a great place to appreciate (and purchase) local art!

Perfect date destination.  My husband and I strolled along and enjoyed the different art. We went on first Friday. Its amazing how many different mediums are used. There was wall art, metals, sculptures, modern even jewelry. You can meet the artists and purchase the art on the spot. After we had dinner at Bu-ku. It was a perfect evening downtown Raleigh.

name: Durant Nature Preserve
address: 8305 Camp Durant Rd, Raleigh, NC 27614, USA
reviews: It was our first visit, and we came for the Winter Solstice Walk. The park is beautiful, perfect for a "tree bath," and the staff were knowledgeable and patient. My son asks a lot of questions all the time, and they were so sweet to him and answered fully, with no sign of frustration, complimented him on asking questions, and invited him back to ask more. I was so touched and appreciative, I could have cried with gratitude. The programming was great. We will be back...many, many times

This is a hidden gem in North Raleigh, especially since the dam repair. Good variety of trails including a fun little mountain bike trail. Nice nature areas for small children as well as access to gentle streams.
Great park! Very well maintained. I look forward to visiting the butterfly garden in spring.

Beautiful local park with a small lake, playground, fields, and lots of events sponsored by the city of Raleigh. For moms with strollers, the rough path down to the lake can be hard to ride on. So just come prepared! Really beautiful in the fall. The hike around the lake is best for adults or older kids because it is a natural path.

Hidden gem in North Raleigh suburbia.  I often come here after work to hike and clear my head.  The forest here is dense and much more mature than you would expect in an urban area.  Although information is hard to come by, the place has an interesting history of being a boy scout camp during the 60's-70's.  There are random structures and shelters throughout the park that must be remnants from that time.

name: Shelley Lake Park
address: 1400 W Millbrook Rd, Raleigh, NC 27612, USA
reviews: A great place to go to enjoy some fresh air.  There is a trail which wraps around the lake which is nice for a walk, run, or bike ride.  Also a great place to just relax and take in nature.  You may see a bald eagle sighting if you visit.

A great park. A pleasant paved loop for walkers. Lots of wildlife. If you keep your eyes open you might catch a glimpse of the pair of bald eagles that live in the park. You might even spot one of the barred owls if you're lucky.

This is a great place to bring your furry friend for a walk. It's a 2 mile walk on a paved trail around the lake. There are plenty of open areas and spots to take a stop, sit on a bench, and enjoy the day.

Since there are always people here it feels like a safe place to walk around and visit the geese and ducks, have a picnic, fly a kite, etc. There is a fishing pier but the paddle boat rentals are gone. The picnic tables and playground are near the art center at the upper parking area. Sometimes you catch a glimpse of the bald eagles that have a nest nearby.

Very nice walking trail around the water. The lake is small, it's more like a 4 or 5 acre pond from back home. It is pretty and a good place to unwind if necessary. The water is dirty/muddy, and there is some trash in the water which is disappointing. There are many different types of fowl located on or near the water including ducks. Other than what I've mentioned, the park deserves a 4 star.

name: Pope House Museum
address: 511 S Wilmington St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: Awesome. The rich history in this place is amazing. Our group really enjoyed the tour.

Very interesting part of Raleigh & African-American history! Admission is free, but please consider dropping some money into the donation box.

Dr. Pope was born to free parents. He graduated from Shaw University, & in 1885 he became the first African-American doctor in NC. He went on to found a medical society & health insurance company, & he had this gorgeous house built on Wilmington Street in 1901. He was a truly exceptional person; I'm surprised so many Raleigh residents seem to know little about him.
This is a wonderful Museum. Been trying to get here for a year and finally visited and it was worth the wait. Only open on Saturdays for tours for a few hours but I highly recommend it.

I really enjoyed my visit. I think they're only open on Saturday so check the schedule before you go. The tour guides were super. the free tour takes about 30 to 40 minutes. Be sure to stop by here as it's walking distance to most of the other attractions downtown.
An amazing slice of history amongst corporate buildings.

name: Laurel Hills Park
address: 3808 Edwards Mill Rd, Raleigh, NC 27612, USA
reviews: Love going to this park. If you have toddler age be prepared for older kids running around too. Amazing playground and love that it has all the ramps. Lots of swings and slides. We love coming here.

Really wonderful park for kids. Best playground I have ever seen - it has something for kids of all ages. I have been taking my son since he was 6 months old (he is 14 months now) - he loves the swings, sandbox, slides, music areas. My nephew loves this playground just as much at 8 yrs old - zipline, basketball, monkey bars.

Such a fun park for kids and families. It has recently been upgraded to become a disability friendly park so there are swings and activities that are accessible to children with disabilities. It is safe and it has a great walking area for dogs/ running and biking. There are basketball courts and fields for activities that need space and covered picnic areas for parties. The inside is very nice as well but I think the outdoor areas are the main attraction.

Amazing park with a lot to do!  I bring my two year old here and she has a blast.  There are always kids of all ages running about, so close supervision with younger kids is strongly suggested.  I've never had any problems, but sometimes kids can get excited and bump into others.

This is a great park with a lot of fun equipment. You have to be active here, especially if you have multiple young kids though - the high/close baluster railings make it difficult to see your kids from across the park. The park is usually very busy and a lot of fun. The park has shelter, but it is typically rented.

name: Historic Oak View County Park
address: 4028 Carya Dr, Raleigh, NC 27610, USA
reviews: There’s so much to explore here, even on a cloudy, winter day! There are indoor exhibits in several well-kept historic buildings and barns. The Farm History Center (like a welcome center) includes an adorable, well-stocked play area for little ones. My toddler loved it! The grounds are pleasant and easy to walk. There are some cute, friendly goats that enjoy carrots (bring your own). I was very impressed by this park and everything it has to offer!

Just completed an absolutely lovely Christmas tour of the homestead and park. It was a completely charming hour spent. The 27 acre site is wonderfully preserved and well maintained. Donna was both an affable and informed tour guide who guided us through the various owners and history beginning with the antebellum period thru the Civil War and then on to the Victorian era followed by the Depression period up through WWII and then onto modern times. She did an amazing job and is an asset to the park. I learned so much and a fun time was had by all. I look forward to returning in Spring when the flowers are in bloom. A total jewel of a park for Wake County residents and it's visitors.

This place is pretty cool! I thought my kiddos would be bored since they're young, 3 years and 1 year, but it was the opposite. They loved running through the beautiful grounds, seeing the chickens and goats but especially the inside exhibit with play kitchen/market and dress up costumes. We'll definitely be back!

Amazing free park! The visitor's center has a fun play area with a market, books, puzzles, costumes etc. Kids can play in the barn and explore the gardens. Each building has interesting displays for all ages.

Wow..this place has it all. A historic 19th century farmstead lovingly preserved. Has a  wonderful visitor center, exhibits on the history of North Carolina's agricultural heritage.  Goats in the barn. A walking trail, picnic shelters and fishing. The staff  is very knowledgeable. It's a place catering to every age group and every season.

name: William B. Umstead State Park
address: 8801 Glenwood Ave, Raleigh, NC 27617, USA
reviews: The boat rental process is really simple and fun for an afternoon of paddling. The trail system is extensive and well marked. It's a great place for trail running! Parking is hectic on the weekends, so plan to get there early if you want to park inside the park.

Those of us that live in the area are fortunate to have a state park so close by to urban areas.  I run often in the park and sometimes fish.  It is a great getaway, as the park is fairly large with numerous trails and lakes.  The hills can be quite challenging, but it's a good place to train for running.  The turkey creek loop is challenging and scenic, and can be used for running, cycling, and horseback riding.  I have camped here once, and it was a pleasant experience, just need to request a space in advance.  There is a large downed tree on Graylyn trail that was beautifully carved by an artist, that is worth seeing.

A fine State Park with a good variety of activity opportunities. I have enjoyed a number of trails of differing lengths in spring, fall and winter, and have never come away disappointed. For a first visit, I would recommend the entrance on the US70 - Glenwood Avenue - rather than the other possibilities. The Visitor Center is a good first stop. But there is so much to go for! The only negative factor: the Park, at least in the more northerly parts, is never peaceful. RDU air traffic is the main cause of the noise. Don't let that stop you going, though!
Well maintained trail. Lots of locals and their pets. Trail hikers and runners and families all walking at the same time simply enjoying the nature and peaceful environment.
One of the best place. Being a lover of nature , i've never seen such a beautiful place. This park has so much of beauty!!

name: Gregg Museum of Art & Design
address: 1903 Hillsborough St, Raleigh, NC 27607, USA
reviews: A great little museum with a constantly changing collection. Definitely worth checking out if you're in the area. The free admission certainly sweetens the pot.
Nice place to visit with friends and family. I had been to a scavenger hunt event here. It was fun.

My first visit.  Small museum but interesting visiting exhibitions.  
Currently a collection of contemporary southern photography.  But for me, the collection of imaginary fauna from the Hokes Archives by Beauvais Lyons is wonderful.
Free parking.

See below for a recap of current exhibits.  It's free!  See photos, too.

The Gregg Museum of Art & Design reopened in its current home at 1903 Hillsborough Street on August 26, 2017.  The museum includes the renovated original NC State University Chancellor’s residence and a recent addition.  The grounds and patios are also a magnificent escape from a busy urban environment.  Include the gardens and paths in your visit.

Entrance to the museum is free, as is parking.  There’s a room in the museum for children to sit and draw and plenty of places for parents and other visitors to sit an enjoy the beautiful environment.  Many old and majestic oaks remind of the time when this was the Chancellor's home.

Restaurants are plentiful just across Hillsborough Street, including David’s Duck & Dumpling, Players Retreat and Gonza Tacos y Tequila (next to the new Aloft Hotel across from the Bell Tower)

Current (2019) programs:
Now open through September 8, 2019
Southern Surreal — Masterpiece Furniture
by Tilden Stone
Don’t miss the eccentric furniture masterpieces by North Carolina’s greatest unsung master maker!  This exhibit presents a unique, beautiful, artful and whimsical stroll through the mind of Tilden Stone as seen through his masterful and creative furniture.  The exhibit is world-class and would not be out of place in any museum.  That it is here in Raleigh is a great gift to the community.  Plan a visit!

Now through July 28, 2019:
Borderlands – Evidence from the Rio Grande
by Susan Harbage Page
Documentary photos and found objects from the US/Mexico border.  This exhibit brings the border crisis off the newspaper and TV screens and places it in a very poignant perspective.  I was unexpectedly engaged and educated on the human side of the difference between an ‘us’ and a ‘them.’

Now open through July 28, 2019:
Explorations — Science Sculptures
by Christina Lorena Weisner
Sculptures with a scientific twist link the gallery with earthquakes, meteorite strikes, and ocean waves

Now open through June 23, 2019:
Left-Handed Liberty — Self-Taught Art
from the Permanent Collection

Great little Museum, till the end of the year they have photos of the South series, a science of genetics gallery, and a whimsical animal gallery. The cost is free they ask for a donation. Not to be missed.

name: WRAL Azalea Garden
address: 2619 Western Blvd, Raleigh, NC 27606, USA
reviews: Cute and quaint gardens that are perfect for portrait sessions. We recently photographed a family at this place and loved how the photos turned out. Photos by: Keepsake Memories Photography

We took a stroll through the garden before doing a tour of the studios. Unfortunately, the azaleas were not in bloom, but several of the rhododendrons were. They have a wide assortment of azaleas and I can only imagine how beautiful the garden is when they are in full bloom. The gardens are well maintained and all the plants are very healthy. They have good signage so you can identify different plants. Overall, a fun experience. We will definitely visit again.
Beautiful park in Raleigh for photos, especially gorgeous when the azaleas are in full bloom! It's very well maintained and has great walking paths throughout the garden.

We took a stroll through the garden before doing a tour of the studios. Unfortunately, the azaleas were not in bloom, but several of the rhododendrons were. They have a wide assortment of azaleas and I can only imagine how beautiful the garden is when they are in full bloom. The gardens are well maintained and all the plants are very healthy. They have good signage so you can identify different plants. Overall, a fun experience. We will definitely visit again.

This place is fantastic. It's rarely crowded unless there's an event that is happening. Watch out for prom season for example. The best time to go is definitely in the spring as I feel the flowers are in bloom during that time. Though there are plenty of year round flowers that can be seen. There are plenty of paths to walk around as well as plentiful seating. Great place for a date or family. You may even catch a wedding.

name: Sassafras All Children's Playground
address: 3808 Edwards Mill Rd, Raleigh, NC 27612, USA
reviews: Tremendously fun playground with area for all ages, and some very cool swings, gliders, and rockers. It's beautiful, large, and bordered by a small lake and a large community center. There are covered pavilions for picnics and birthday parties. There are so many cool pieces to play with, and several playgrounds, including a sand pit for the littlest ones. A small path surrounding the park is good for light exercise. There is also a basketball court, baseball field, and soccer field directly adjacent to the playgrounds. Absolutely awesome!

This park is full of enjoyment and excitement for my toddler. They do have different sections for older and toddler kids. Its nice clean, family friendly park with options for older kids to play basketball as well.

This playground is massive. It's like they took 4 separate jungle gyms and put them together. Plus: a sand pit, swings, and zip line. Very wheelchair friendly. Nice bathrooms and a walking trail around a lake. My 3 year old spent hours playing here and didn't get bored once.

The only reason I didn't give five stars is because of inconsistent closures throughout the year. Otherwise, it's a great playground for both young and school age children. Multiple slides and swings available. Also, there are zip line style swings for all age kids. It's a nice place for beginning walkers, with ramps and nice wide passages on the jungle gyms. There is a covered pavilion and a few picnic tables on the grounds. There is a pond with a small walkway and a basketball court available as well. The bathrooms are convenient and clean and there is ample parking.
Wow! This playground is amazing! Lots of fun new equipment to play on.

name: North Carolina State University Memorial Belltower
address: 2011 Hillsborough St, Raleigh, NC 27607, USA
reviews: Beautiful architecture. Makes me think of my father and the journey he must have had throughout his college years.

This was a nice stop while we were in the area. The tower is beautiful and hearing the bells is definitely amazing. Plus the area around it has tons of grass which us great for kids to run and play. The area is perfect to park and walk the street as there are some cute little restaurants and shops nearby. Great monument at the gateway to North Carolina State University. Hope you get a nice sunny day to take good photos

I got a tour of the Bell Tower from inside, guided by Dr. Thomas H. Stafford Jr. The newly created green space on the north side of the Talley Student Union is named the Stafford Commons in recognition of Thomas H. Stafford, Jr’s years of service to the university. 
Dr. Stafford briefly narrated the history of the Bell Tower, it's significance and the timeline of its construction. After narrating the history, he asks us a question based on the names of the fallen heroes carved on the granite inside the Bell Tower. When no one is able to answer the question, the answer leaves us amazed!

A beautiful monument. The Belltower is definitely an essential sight of Raleigh with great significance for the North Carolina State University students and community. I can't wait till the new bells are installed and ringing.

The impressive Bell Tower and lovely Harden Family Memorial Gardens, adjacent to the North Carolina State Capitol, Raleigh, make a fine place to rest and meditate on life's blessings and challenges. Being right next to the First Presbyterian Church makes the spot convenient for worshipers, as well. Very nice tower, represents the university. Lights up red when NC State win a game.

name: Lake Crabtree County Park
address: 1400 Aviation Pkwy, Morrisville, NC 27560, USA
reviews: Awesome set of hikes and mountain bike trails. Both aspects have intermediate to advanced levels. I personally was doing hiking and found that my couple mile hike around one side of the lake to be engaging and fun at the same time. My son got to play on the new playground that have intriguing learning activities for kids of all ages. There was different obstacles, musical toy steel drum, couple slides, and little critical thinking activities with blocks and magnets. Overall, great place to just get out of the house and enjoy the great outdoors, right in Raleigh's "backyard". Also attached to the Greenway for runners and bikes

They have a great mtb trail system that is while lesser known very enjoyable. The woods are beautiful and the sunsets are great. I used to really enjoy sailing there but they sadly got rid of that. Back to the trails there are some titles “black diamond” but they are more like intermediate but the jump trail is very enjoyable they aren’t huge but they are smooth and well built and easily gaped. Overall it is a great park and has fun trails and all sorts of activities to do I would highly recommend coming here just be warned that if it rains the trails will be closed for at least 2 days.
Turns out to be a great park. Kiddos love it. Lived here 8 yrs. Visited only a few times. So much to do.  We visit here often

Great place to find a variety of birds, some pretty views, half the times I come here I see male and female bald eagles flying over the lake (be patient and look closely as they can be tricky to spot amongst the large flocks of gulls cormorants and other birds). By the North (aviation pkwy entrance) parking lot there is a big field for kids to play and 2 sand volleyball courts. 6 mile trail around the lake; gets narrow and a rocky on the NE side where trail runs alongside the road.
The beech picnic area and playground are great! Our 18 month old had a ball running around. The park is clean and the picnic area was great!

name: Moore Square
address: 226 E Martin St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: Moore Square is a wonderful small community. It is always so positive. Marbles kids museum has fun things for small children to do and visits will be playing there quite often. Every once in a while on Sunday they will play a movie sponsored by the IMAX theatre. Pianos provide musical fun. Square Burger is a cute little restaurant for a quick meal. Superb milkshakes. Behind Square Burger is an innovative playground for kids.

They really cleaned this area out nicely. The bus station is clean & a bit safer, the park is huge & beautiful, & they built a nice little burger joint convenient to anyone in that area. I had a great time there with my family & we for sure will return.

The Bus Drivers are very helpful when I am getting on the bus and off  I'm in a wheelchair with one leg. They make sure that I am locked in. Keep up the good work. go Raleigh Busses Thank you'll so much. be Blessed always.

This is a great place to come and experience Raleigh community. Greenspace right in the heart of downtown. Safe, peaceful, relaxing. Kids having a blast playing outside in the fresh air.  Definitely check it out!

First time going to 1st night with the family and it was a lot of fun. Tons of activities for all members of the family regardless of age. If you haven't been, 2021 would be a great way to start your new year here

name: Prairie Ridge Ecostation
address: 1671 Gold Star Dr, Raleigh, NC 27607, USA
reviews: A great place to bring the family regardless of age. The nature playspace is perfect for little ones to run around and play. From the sandbox to the camping area to the stage and all things in-between, there is plenty to keep the kids entertained. Plus the hiking trail is just long enough to stretch your legs and enjoy the outdoors.
What a great place for kids of all ages! Lots of places to get dirty, climb, dig for fossils, and be in nature. Plenty of seating for adults, shade, and all the activities are close to each other.
Wonderful place, always plenty of interesting activities for all ages and knowledgeable educators
Awesome place for the kids to play and learn about natural. Great for helping to cultivate a love for the outdoors in a controlled environment

Really cool shaded playground. Definitely one of the top free best place to bring the kids in Raleigh. Only complain is that they don't have any trash cans, so be prepared and bring empty bags to pack any trash that you might have.

name: Adventure Landing
address: 3311 Capital Blvd, Raleigh, NC 27604, USA
reviews: This place is a lot of fun to bring the kids. It's a little older and run down than some of the newer places but just as fun. They do not serve beer or it would be a fun place for adult groups to meet as well. Take the kids and have a great couple hours.

Had a 7 y/o birthday party here. For the price, I was very impressed. It was all inclusive, and all the kids were tired when they left... So mission accomplished! The staff was pretty awesome, and the facility was nice. Only request is that they should serve beer for the grown ups, but oh well =)

I wish I could give this place a better review but every time my family and I have been it’s been terrible. The machines are constantly broke, bathrooms are always terrible with no toilet paper and the #1 thing that bothers me is that the employees always seem annoyed especially if you need help because THEIR machine is broken, just haven’t experienced a good time here and I definitely would not recommend.

The only reason I can't give adventure landing 5 stars is that it is in need of renovations.  It's just not a modern place.  That having been said, it's fun and the kids don't care that it's not attractive.  It's a good value.  There's almost always a Groupon available, so check that out before you pay full price.  They have laser tag, 3 mini golf courses (bumpy in places), go carts, and an arcade.  They have a snack bar with pizza and fries and stuff like that, but I've never eaten there.  Your kids will have fun here.  You might crave different scenery, but you'll be happy you're not forking over a small fortune for the kids to have fun.
Maintanence was obviously very low. Good atmosphere but two of the three machines took my coins. Staff was good but games definitely need an update

name: Joel Lane Museum House
address: 160 S St Mary's St, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews: Great place to get in touch with local history.  Multiple buildings, and outdoor exhibits during their bi-annual open houses.  The docents are all welcoming and very knowledgeable.  Note that due to the historical design, not all areas are handicapped accessible.

The Joel Lane house is one of my favorite places to visit in Raleigh - it's the oldest house in Wake County.... 1769.  The tour cost about $7 or $8 and the entrance fee is worth it and goes toward the restoration of the property.  Make sure you tour all the buildings.  It is worth attending one of their special events when the staff and volunteers are in period costume.

This visit was a planned stop. I had read a bit about the Joel Lane Museum and wanted to know more. We went on a 45-60 minute tour of the house and small grounds surrounding, guided by the museum director. He was very informative and gracious and obviously had a true interest in sharing what is known about Joel Lane and his family. We enjoyed this tour immensely and would recommend it to anyone with an interest in history and culture who is traveling in the Raleigh area.
Very nice small living history museum. A great view into colonial history of Raleigh.
The volunteers are very informative and gave a nice tour

name: Raleigh-Durham International Airport Observation Park
address: W International Dr, Morrisville, NC 27560, USA
reviews: This is a great place to watch planes taking off and landing! While we were there, on a Sunday afternoon, we probably saw at least twenty planes landing and taking off during the hour we spent at the observation park! Definitely a great place to take children! There is a runway area and a sand box that they can play in!

Haven't seen a really good sunset yet. I'll keep trying. It's a nice spot. Never more than a handful of people there and there's a small playground. Wouldn't call it a destination but if you're close or passing by during sunset it's probably worth a stop

My husband visited this place yesterday. 

He says it's a good place to see the planes flying. 

The frequency of planes coming here is definitely less. 

So you need to spend few hours in hand to enjoy the show. 

The place is sunny. 

There is place to stand. 

The places is vibrant. 

The place is definitely good for kids. 

The place is good for oldies too. 

It is easily accessible. 

Good washrooms
Awesome location to watch 👀 airplanes ✈️ take off!!!! Great place for your child to play while watching the planes take off! 😊🛫🤸🏽‍♂️

Started hanging out here when my son was 1.  He is now 16.  He still enjoys it and has a complete fascination with airplanes now!  Take a picnic and enjoy your time there.  They have a small kids area for the little ones to enjoy.

name: Horseshoe Farm Nature Preserve
address: 2900 Horse Shoe Farm Rd, Wake Forest, NC 27587, USA
reviews: If you want to find some peace and quiet this is a good place for it..there are trails to walk and ride bikes.  There is a large field and plenty of wildlife around.  There is a picnic area as well and it's covered.  Public bathrooms are there.  enjoy!

Good example of a city and surrounding towns integrating greenways, natural areas and parks to connect neighborhoods. Their efforts should be a benchmark for other towns to encourage outdoor recreation and connectivity in North Carolina.

It's pretty sparse if you are looking for playgrounds or things to entertain kids but it's excellent for a big space to run around, see small wildlife, and great access to the Neuse River Greenway. It has a nice picnic shelter and public bathrooms. There is a historic farm house but we have not visited it yet. The parking area closes at night so make sure to check the park times before going.
A pretty small, but charming park. A good place to bring the dog. Lots of open space to spot dear in the early hours of the morning

I personally enjoy the park as just a nice nature area to relax and hang out with the family. Maybe have a picnic, listen to some music. It's a large field with a nice trail for walking or biking. If you prefer parks with more attractions then look else where.

name: ROOM 5280 - Raleigh Live Escape Games
address: 123 Glenwood Ave, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews: Went here for a work/team building outing and we all had a blast! Andrew, our host, did a great job running both the Sherlock and Dark rooms we did. The atmosphere of the stories behind the rooms were engaging and the my group was able to finish with minimal clues. Clues were given to us only twice, and they were only ever confirmation of things we had already figured out but by chance hadn't worked. Would definitely recommend trying this place out with any medium-to-large group

Had a great time here! Andrew is really friendly and is a great host. The place is located downtown (good location and parking) and is literally in a house. The rooms were well designed and both our groups were able to complete the puzzles! It is great for team building. However, the gadgets/contraptions used were not the most advanced that I have seen! Would still definitely go again.

What a great experience! Our group of six did the Heist room and had a wonderful time. The puzzles were challenging, but not impossible, so we never felt like we were at an impasse. It took the ideas and contributions of all of us to solve the puzzles. Everything was very inventive and well thought out. It was such a sense of accomplishment to finish each puzzle and escape from the room! This would be a great team-building experience. I’m looking forward to going back and trying another room. Highly, highly recommended!

We did the Sherlock themed room. It was fun and had some cool features, but it wasn't overly high-tech or unique. The hostess also came over the intercom and gave us a couple clues that we did not ask for, which was a bummer. However we only had 3 minutes to spare when we escaped, so maybe it was better that she did that.

This was our first for escape rooms & we really  enjoyed.  However the room became uncomfortably warm & the smaller room was hot.  I was sweating slightly & my friend's mom had sweat all over her face.  Thankfully she pulled out a large folding hand fan to cool herself down.

name: Historic Yates Mill County Park
address: 4620 Lake Wheeler Rd, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews:
This is a beautiful place to visit. It is very easy to find, easy parking. They have some hiking trails, you can walk around the lake. The visitor center is very informative and kid friendly. They have a kids corner where the kids can play and also dress up. 
The mill itself is very pretty, they offer tours on weekends. 
The bathrooms were clean and wheelchair accessible. The boardwalk and visitor center are wheelchair accessible as well. 
I would definitely visit again when I'm in the area again.

As new residents of NC, our family visited Yates Mill on a sunny day in March. It is an excellent historical and scenic tour. Our guide was compassionate and knowledgeable about the Mill and its surroundings. Restoration of the mill after Hurricane Fran is a prime example of what a group of concerned citizens can accomplish to preserve important historical landmarks to share with future generations. Thank you.
I'm right along with most people who visit here. It's a very relaxing walk around the trail. Highly recommend a visit.

We were visiting this area in early November. My brother and I are photography buffs. We thought the mill would be a great subject. It did not disappoint. The park is gorgeous. The museum on the grounds was an added bonus. It is a wonderful facility. I really enjoyed the exhibits and learning more about the mill.
It's always a pleasure to spend time at this place, walk around or have a picnic. Definitely, a nice stop to just enjoy the view and explore a little bit.

name: Dorothea Dix Park
address: 2105 Umstead Dr, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews: Thank you for taking the time to grow such beautiful sunflowers for the public to enjoy! 🌻 Dorothea dix has done it again. They took the time to make an amazing sunflower garden for the public to come and view, take pictures at and enjoy. I think it’s amazing that this park continuously each year grows the sunflowers for the public. In addition, when reading one of the signs it notes that the location used to be a landfill and the sunflowers help to produce a healthier and environmentally friendly atmosphere - which is added bonus points!

We came for the sunflowers! We waited a week or 2 after it looked like they were blooming so we got a full dose of sunflower goodness. I'd highly recommend this field for photographers, novice or professional. Such a lovely setting.
Great place. Lots of areas. Designated a drone and RV Plane safe park. Join a local club.
First time at the park and i love it and my little one as well!! It's huge, has amazing views to the city!! And the sunflowers are so pretty!!

Dix park has such an interesting history and a great layout. I really enjoyed taking a tour of the old State Hospital and exploring the rest of the grounds. I visited right after they cut down the sun flowers, but it was still a beautiful area.

name: Oakwood Dog Park
address: 910 Brookside Dr, Raleigh, NC 27604, USA
reviews: This was our first time going there. It's just an all around nice park for you as well as man's best friend. Come make a new friend or two. There's plenty of parking.
Friendly environment. Spacious. CLEAN.
There is a small and large dog section. The areas were nice and kept clean. A lot of old leaves on the ground that the dogs had a fun time playing in.

The Oakwood Dog Park is an amazing park! Plenty of space for dogs to run around, and I really appreciate the double gate to ensure no pups escape while greeting a new friend into the park! There is plenty of shade as well as multiple water spigots so the dogs can stay nice and hydrated.

I love this place! It's amazing to me that a dog park of this magnitude exists in such a great location on such valuable land. Our dog Gus loves being social here, greeting new arrivals at the gate, and then taking off on his self-guided circumference walks around the park. The hose with fresh water is👌, and the puppy pool is fantastic during warm weather

name: African American Cultural Complex
address: 119 Sunnybrook Rd, Raleigh, NC 27610, USA
reviews: It's closed until further notice but I met the owner and she was a sweet lady. She said they are planning to move to Dorthea Dix in a few years
Intriguing the amount of information that's on hand here. History lesson  that was much needed
pleasant! I've actually done community service here!
Was great
Would to bring our youth group back. Alot of history and a lot of love

name: Sacred Heart Catholic Church
address: 200 Hillsborough St, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews:
Beautiful church amazing reminder that Gods forever present. I love to come here to admire the tranquility and beauty of this beautiful sanctuary.

God bless

Beautiful Church with MAGNIFICENT Stained glass. The message was on point. Especially loved the confession immediately after Mass and the prayer garden behind the church under the trees was cool, even on a hot summer day.

Sacred Heart Church is a Catholic church located on Hillsborough Street in downtown Raleigh, North Carolina, United States. The church served as the cathedral of the Diocese of Raleigh from 1924 to 2017.

Bishop: Luis R. Zarama

Beautiful church, and, despite all the other churches we took in, the Catholic Church was the only one open. Who's welcome now? Say what you want about us Catholics, but you truly are welcome in our churches!

We attended mass at Sacred Heart on a recent trip to Raleigh. The people of the parish were very welcoming and friendly. The Father was interactive and gave a great homily. The church is small in size to be a Cathedral but it has a lot of charm and history. I know the parishioners were excited about the new Cathedral opening soon.

name: Nash Square
address: 200 S McDowell St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: Small but beautiful park in downtown Raleigh. We saw lots of wedding parties taking pictures here, but beyond being a scenic photo spot or a relaxing place to eat lunch, there's not much here. It seems safe enough and had lots of families strolling through on the weekend. Worth a stop if you're walking around in the area.
Got some great shots of my girl on graduation day

Cool little park here in the city its small but has everything you need in a small area. They have some monuments that the kids liked and cool to take pictures with. 

Park is well kept up, clean all around, and I didnt really see any weird people around. 

Parking around here isn't great but sure if you live nearby you know the situation here. 

Overall its a nice park and would recommend checking it out.

It's the closest public park within the city center. It's got lots of trees that provides shades from the searing heat when it's a hot day, tons of benches to sit and unwind on. It's close to other memorial parks and the museums. Good detour for visiting out-of-towners. It's also one of the stops in the Ghost tours provided by @TobaccoRoadTours.
Beautiful place. Great atmosphere. Great place for walk.

name: Anderson Point Park
address: 20 Anderson Point Dr, Raleigh, NC 27610, USA
reviews: A beautiful place to go any day, any time. An amazing walking trail that follows the Neuse River to venture on. It's a calming and great for the kids. There's a big field, right by the park, for anything like soccer up to baseball. There is two main eating areas where a bathroom available beside the field and park.
Never too busy, good for my son since he doesn't do too well with crowds. Wish the parking lot want so far from party, but it's a good walk

One of my favorite places to run and bike. It's always very clean, I have never not felt safe while on the trial or in the park area. I love that there is a bathroom and water fountains available. The scenery is nice while you walk, run, or bike. I do enjoy that the landscape varies, there are hills and curves, bridges...etc.

I'm sure most in the area already have been, but first time for us. Major crossroads of a number of regional bicycle trails with full conveniences including a bike repair station with tools and air pump. Bench swings, large playground, and picnic shelters. Big thumbs up!

This is a great park and is a good place to fill up your water if your going for a long bike ride. The park also seems very entertaining to kids. The lighting is good at night and also seems enjoyable for a stop on biking adventures.

It also seems like a good park to have a picnic! I would recommend checking out the swinging benches here and also it's a good spot to take pictures at!
KF

name: Millbrook Exchange Park
address: 1905 Spring Forest Rd, Raleigh, NC 27615, USA
reviews: A fun park to play at! Plenty of benches for parents/grandparents to rest while kids play. Easy access to plenty of parking and the Community Center has access to clean bathrooms. We'll definitely be going back to play again!

First time at the park. What fun! I'm impressed that dog owners were respectful and picked up after their dog. Small dog side is huge compared to other off leash parks I've been to. Such a nice day today, we had 12 dogs! Highly recommend

Good quantity of hard courts (like 23). It does tend to host a lot of leagues so if you wanna know if courts are gonna be available I recommend calling. You can reserve for a fee or you can call ahead and just show up for free if something is available. The quality of the courts is pretty good. The lights are great on the lower courts. Pretty poor on the upper courts as they aren't very bright and so there are a ton of shadows. Two benches on every court is nice. They offer lessons, too.

Great facility. Saw a children league basketball game. Awesome coaching skills. The referee was fantastic in teaching the fundamentals.  Outside is a playground.  Great parking and more to use on site.
Loved the park! It was our 1st time there. It was clean and loved the soft turf. And the 2 different playgrounds for younger and older kids

name: Downtown Raleigh
address: 300 Fayetteville St, Raleigh, NC 27602, USA
reviews: Visited 48th annual historic Oakwood candlelight tour.  Quite impressive, but is more geared toward the home's characteristics versus Christmas and it's time of year.
Vibrant and trendy with lots of nice eateries and wide walkways. The people seem to enjoy it, and it feels safe.
Halloween is a serious celebration at this historic neighborhood

charming
Soo love 😍😍😍
I love downtown Raleigh it is always something to do.

name: Fred Fletcher Park
address: 820 Clay St, Raleigh, NC 27605, USA
reviews: Perl of the Glenwood South district. Good for a party at a shelter. Beautiful setting for proposal and wedding. Great for jogging, walking, music etc
Nice park to go walk around. Small playground has swings and some spring riding toys.
Wonderful park and dog friendly! Usually full of people even on a yucky weather day. Make sure your dog is on a leash because not everyone out here adheres to leash laws or have dogs with manners.

Married my husband here and walk through almost every day with my dog. It’s about the most perfect city park I’ve seen, to the point that my housing is planned around easy access. I miss the huge oaks that fell in hurricane Matthew (and the shade they provided to the playground), but this place still has a lot to offer.

What a little gem of a park!  Not very large but a lovely green oasis just minutes from the heart of downtown Raleigh.  The old homes  you can walk into are beautiful.  A well kept secret worth visiting.

name: Knightdale Station Park
address: 810 N First Ave, Knightdale, NC 27545, USA
reviews: The park has lots of great options for individuals if all ages. Their is a walking path, a nearby did park and fields, and playground equipment for a variety of age ranges. There is also a new splash pad area that is open during the warmer months that is pretty great.  The park is not fenced in and there is a water feature nearby that has a simple wooden fence that children can easily sneak through so not the best park of you're looking to just let your kids free roam.

This is one of my favorite parks in the area. The park has slides, swings, mommy and me swings, splash playground, dog park, walking trails, sand boxes, open fields. We usually bring our scooters and bikes and ride around a little, then play on the playground. 
The park hosts some fun events like food truck rodeos that we also enjoy.

Today, it was perfect - a lovely day just before the rain, I had the park to myself. I'm not sure what it would be like when full of people. I can say that it's a lovely park with a good playground & dog park. The paths are in good condition & everything I saw was clean & well maintained. There are sports fields & a picnic shelter. On one side is a local brewery, & on another there soon will be a terrific barbeque restaurant.

We love it here. The play area, is nice and diverse. The splash pad is new and has shaded seating for parents, which is definitely needed! The grassy area near the pavilion is nice, with seating. There are plenty of paved trails for walking and biking, and our family really enjoys them. We also like the pond.

One of the cleanest parks I’ve brought the kids to play. Just enough to keep children of all ages busy for hours. There is a splash pad during the summer and a dog park separated for small size and larger size dogs.

name: Greater Raleigh Convention and Visitors Bureau
address: One Bank of America Plaza, 421 Fayetteville St STE 1505, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: Love this historic city full of life, entertainment, restaurants, festivals. See events for schedule theres always something to do.
Great facility for a convention. Concessions are priced too high.
The people here were extremely helpful in giving us maps and telling us anything we wanted to know about the area, how to get around, and more!

name: North Carolina Museum of Art Parking
address: 1900 Blue Ridge Rd, Raleigh, NC 27607, USA
reviews:
Not only is the NCMA museum free, the parking is too. Not many museums can claim that. It's a huge lot which is also popular with hikers on the art trails. If full, drive around the museum for more parking on other side. 
During the State Fair days, watch the fireworks over the nearby fairgrounds from here.

I love going to this place. I make sure to visit at least twice a year. The outside is so fun for a nice walk with the family and the inside is great for a lunch date. Much better than going to a movie! So glad this exists in NC!

Very spacious parking lot. Enough room to host quite. Few people. Love the fact no matter where you park, there is some kind of activity that you can do or see. One side of the parking lot has the art museum and the other side of the parking lot has the many walking trails. Which is another great site to see. Art all along the trails! And they seem to go so far with sculptures in the middle of the wall. There also a place where they seem to host events, like an arena.

The parking lot is huge... and FREE!!! It's super easy to get into and out of, and there are a good number of handicapped spots down between the two main buildings. The only thing I could say that I didn't necessarily like was the fact that there is basically zero shade in the parking lot.
Parking was very friendly, especially for those of us who are handicapped, and needed to be dropped off closer to the museum.

name: Carolina Pines Dog Park
address: 2305 Lake Wheeler Rd, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews: Love the openness of this park and how shady it is throughout. Just be aware that not every GPS will take you to the exact location of this park. It's towards the back, behind the baseball fields. Everyone I met was always friendly, and most watched their dogs closely. There are pools for the dogs, buckets of water for them to drink from, and potty bags all around. There's also a separate section for smaller dogs. Plenty of seating for you to enjoy while your dog socializes.

I enjoy taking my cockapoo to Carolina Pines Dog Park. This is a very large dog park with three separate sections. It is fairly well maintained and the people that visit the park seem friendly and attentive to their dogs. There is plenty of parking here. There are bags and tennis balls available here to use. There is also a water spout and plenty of buckets. I recommend this dog park.

Awesome dog park with friendly owners. It's separated into 3 fenced areas - one for small dogs, one for large dogs, and one that's not labeled. Be aware that while the area is handicapped accessible the ground is natural cover and slopes away from the entrance so you probably should avoid it in a wheelchair unless you have somebody to push you back out
This dog park has 2 fenced areas. 1 small for small dogs & 1 big for the big dogs. Lots of trees available for tinkling on too! Actually I think the trees should be thinned out some!
I love it. Has 3 separate areas. 1 huge! Area and 1 smaller and then 1 a bit smaller for small dogs. There are trees, water, and bags for the number 2s. My baby girl loved it.

name: John Chavis Memorial Park
address: 505 Martin Luther King Jr Blvd, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: Home to a wonderful 1916 Herschel carousel in immaculate condition, complete with operating band organ!  Beautifully maintained and restored, the glory of the whirling painted horses and vintage paintings could have enthralled me for hours.  The De Kleinst band organ is well maintained and sounds great as it plays "The Time Warp" with just a touch of ironic anachronism!
Took my birthday pictures here on the stone steps. Very quiet and my kids love the playground.
Nice  Park for family for the summer as well as the winter.. They have Pinic area for Winter with Fire place.. And they are getting to make the Park Even better Cant wait..

Nice historical park with new carousel house (original building is still on the property), pool, and playground. The playground has vintage equipment for older kids — metal slides and ride-on toys — that creates nostalgia from my own childhood, but get much too hot to be usable on a sunny day. The toddler equipment (the label says it is designed for children aged 2–5) is made of the newer recycled plastic material, and this portion was under the shade of trees, which was nice on a hot day when we visited. The ground is sand in the entire playground area, which is quite large. There are also swings, including a few bucket style for young kids. The water fountain wasn't in operation and there was a little bit of trash on the playground, but nothing too unusual.

My son liked it, but I wasn't too keen. It's close to home. I don't care for the sand or metal equipment.  2 slides were too hot to use. I wish there was a bathroom close to the playground. Otherwise,  quiet and spacious.  The toddler play set was well shaded.

name: Raleigh Fire Museum
address: 105 Keeter Center Dr, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: In the museum there is a beautiful bell, and many historical objects that show us how the fire fighting evolved. Very didactic for children to visit.

A fantastic small fire station currently used as a training ground. Every second Saturday of the month admission is free. A guaranteed 30 min fun for you and your kids. Parking is provided on the ground for free.
Had a ton of fun bringing our son to see the truck and try out the fire hose. The little museum is interesting too.
Great place to see the history of the Raleigh Fire Department
Lots of interesting, nostalgic pieces surrounding the history of the Raleigh Fire Department.

name: Lake Lynn Park
address: Lynn Rd, Raleigh, NC 27613, USA
reviews: Need to rejuvenate your soul or get a quick run? Lake Lynn is one of my favorite spots in North Raleigh to do just that! The loop around the lake is 2.25 miles, all paved with a few bridges.  It’s peaceful and beautiful.  Plenty of parking too! So get your groove on and visit this gem.

Very nice park/lake. Very beautiful piece of nature in the middle of town. I've always felt safe here and really like fishing, hiking and running here. Good place for the whole family and the dogs love it here too!  It's bigger than it looks from the road. I would definitely recommend this place as a great place to walk  or run. Fishing is decent.

This is a great place to walk around and take in the nature around you. Great boardwalk around the lake and nice place to stop and sit. You will see different types of geese, herons, ducks and some fish too! The community center is current undergoing renovations but there is still a great playground and other recreational attractions too. You never know what you’ll see when you go out for a stroll.

I had a nice walk. The trail is great for a leisurely walk especially if you're a lake person. The runners and dog walkers were courteous. I'm surprised more people weren't fishing. I saw bass all over.
It's a great place for a quiet stroll with lovely sites. You can find all sorts of birds and turtles around the area. And if you're a pokemon go fan, there are several gyms and stops around the way.

name: Oakwood Cemetery
address: 701 Oakwood Ave, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: As a cemetery enthusiast I loved visiting! the grounds are lovely. a great place to just visit.
My eight-time great-grandfather Martin Pfeifer and my family was buried there can't wate go visted some day
