My Father is in this cemetery along with my Grandparents, and everything has been okay until today. My family planned a remembrance dinner in my Father's honor, so we called the cemetery and checked the Google page hours and both showed it was open until 6pm.  I pull up to the main gate at 4:57pm and it's chained shut, now we can't go visit my Father and the head lady there named Robin tells me they close early after the clocks are set back.  Not sure why, since it's 5:30pm and the sun is still out...I'm very displeased right now since I drove 45 minutes from Benson and the rest  of my family was meeting me there.
Beautiful cemetery!
AMAZING

name: Midtown Park
address: 4011 Cardinal at North Hills Street, Park at N Hills St, Raleigh, NC 27609, USA
reviews: Very nice place.  I visited the park the last weekend during The Wine Fest. I enjoyed the place very clean and nice.ill be back for sure.
Great public space. Was here for a classis motorcycle show, and the venue was perfect for it. Wish there was something like this in my hometown.
Fantastic modern feeling area with great entertainment , food , and lodging accommodations. This area can even make a bowling alley look classy!

Had the relay for Life of Raleigh there. Fantastic area! Parking plentiful because of the various parking decks! Wonderful balcony apartments( lucky people who already live there!) Nice outdoor venue for the band we had. Nice play park for kids and pets (gotta bring the leash! ) It's within walking distance to a variety of eateries, grocery stores, and hotels.The entire area was so clean!! Literally, we were amazed at the upkeep! Felt safe even at night!  If I had known about this place, I would have searched  to live here myself:-) I will definitely be back! Kudos to the establishment!!
Beautiful clean park. We went when nothing was going and it was beautiful. The tree also light up at night.

name: Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Memorial Gardens
address: 1215 Martin Luther King Jr Blvd, Raleigh, NC 27610, USA
reviews: THIS IS VERY BEAUTIFUL FOR REV. DR. MARTIN LUTHER KING ! TO HONOR ALL THAT HE STOOD FOR

The monument was quite beautiful and along the walls the famous and inspiring words of MLK were carved into stone. Reading them really gave me a sense of who he was. The location and the actual monument itself are quite pretty. The statue is quite impressive too.
Nice clean public park. Small but efficient.  Plenty of parking and self interpretation.
It's awesome to have such a nice park dedicated to Dr. King. He is a very prominent and determining factor in where America is today. He is sorely missed but will never be forgotten.

As a European American who rejects bigotry and mourns the victims of slavery in teh Americas, my visiting this memorial was especially meaningful. It is a pleasant place to be, as it denotes the peacefulness that MLK advanced. The park represents the commitment of the Raleigh community to inclusiveness and civil rights. It reminds one of the righteous stature of a man who stood up for the American creed (All persons are created equal), for the true meaning of religion (Love), for human brotherhood, and for (Yes), the Dream. It is simply a park, not a museum or historical site. Plan a family get-together, a picnic, or just walk around and enjoy the landscape. Read the inscriptions on the fountain. It is small in size as parks go, but what it represents is huge.

name: Carl Alwin Schenck Memorial Forest
address: Raleigh, NC 27607, USA
reviews: Beautiful trails, alot of trees down probably some major going on.
Beautiful place to walk around and enjoy nature. Trails are not very well marked so make sure you have your GPS/Phone with you.

Beautiful and well maintained forest just outside of Umstead Park. 
Much fewer people compared to Umstead or Eno and the Forest is in great shape as it’s essentially and laboratory for forestry students at NC State. 

The trails are short and make for a nice 30-75 minute hike. 
Dirt road to enter and may be muddy after some rain.
Love that u can just go wherever  no dogs sadly  but there are many deer trails!! Great park!

Fantastic place to go if you want to spend time hiking around. I go out there often with my classes at NCSU. 

You can yell in the forest and it's so dense that no one will hear you, but do be respectful of wildlife.

There are pine orchards that were planted in the 80's that are fun to find. Try identifying all of the different trees, you will have a blast!

name: Carolina Touring Company
address: W Martin St, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews: Loved our scooter tour of Oakwood today. Our guide Todd was extremely knowledgeable and the scooters were a ton of fun to ride. I've lived in Raleigh for 27 years and learned a lot about its past and present while on the tour, so this tour is great for locals and visitors alike.

We had a fabulous time this past weekend with Mimi in Raleigh learning about our home city!!!!  Ryan was also a terrific host. Strongly recommend for friends, family, locals or tourists. Thank you Mimi and Ryan.
Fun ride!

Yes, better than Segways! These machines are delightful to drive. Expert training in 5 minutes. The tour was Historic Oakwood and very very insightful. Headphones so ya can hear the guide, but still hear traffic and talk to someone. Highly recommend this experience!
So much fun! Our tour guide was great! What a wonderful way to get to know Raleigh 👏🏼

name: Sertoma Arts Center
address: 1400 W Millbrook Rd, Raleigh, NC 27612, USA
reviews:
Love the trails but wish the water fountains worked when I was there.
Did tai chi on the grass with a group and had an easy time of it.
Have also been here to vote. 
Handicapped parking is easy to access and use when I need it. Plenty of other parking for when I don't.
The clay studio is always very clean, the staff and other potters are all friendly and knowledgeable, and there is a clear and orderly firing system.
Always a nice place to visit and see some art as well as take a walk around the lake.

At Shelley Lake Park. Nice art exhibits, playground, lake, creek, 2+ mile paved greenway. Saw art, geese, ducks, heron or two, some turtles, bikers, walkers, kiddos and doggies. Great place to spend some quality time.

Pottery studio here is great. Wheel and handbuilding classes are run by fantastic potters. If pottery isn't your thing, take an art class, jewelery making class, or a fitness class. Hidden gem located at a great city park.

name: Buffaloe Road Athletic Park
address: 5812 Buffaloe Rd, Raleigh, NC 27616, USA
reviews: Nice dog park in back. We we t to walk on the connected Nuse River trail. Easy parking. Nice track. Haven't checked out the aquatic building.
This park is incredibly well maintained. It is connected to the neuse river Greenway and is a good place to park and walk. They have a lovely dog park that has a good bit of shade.
Great for walking and bike riding , extreemly clean trails, there is a dig area and aquatic center here . Great for family outing .
The food is good. They work fast and the place is clean. Is very busy as well. The parking lot is very busy and small, is a bit difficult to get in and out. Overall it's a good place.

This park has a few great features including a nice playground area (next to restrooms), an open space multi-purpose field surrounded by a 1/4 mile track, several baseball fields, and an aquatic center. The only negative about the park is that they keep the baseball fields locked up. So don't go expecting to "bat a few balls around". Another drawback to the park is there are only a couple picnic tables next to the playground. There are no other tables in the park. The best feature, and probably least used, is the access to the Greenway. You can find this access near the aquatic center.

name: Cedar Hills Park
address: 5600 Sweetbriar Dr, Raleigh, NC 27609, USA
reviews: I come here to play disc golf fairly often. I like this coarse. It has some challenging holes and most are fairly wooded. I think Kentwood is better for beginners but this is a nice moderate next step up.
Great frisbee course and location grills and benches also available
Nice facility.  Has an 18 hole disc golf course that is excellent.  Children's playground is available.

Clean park, lots to do. Disc golf course is fun and challenging with a mixture of wooded and open holes. Have basketball courts and tennis courts along with a playground. Good place to spend an afternoon.
Fun local disc golf park. Rarely crowded. There is also tennis courts, a baseball field and a playground.

name: Sunflower Field
address: Raleigh, NC 27606, USA
reviews: Beautiful, well-maintained fields that attract a lot of visitors. Do come early to avoid crowds and heat. Several varieties are planted from multi-branching to dwarf to mammoth Russian sunflowers. Expect to spend 40 to 60 minutes or more exploring the many rows and paths. Lots of good picture spots. Watch for bees and please don't pick or destroy any sunflowers.
I'm so glad we have sunflowers!  I miss the old field but understand why they were moved to here.  I like they're so close and parking (legal) is adjacent to the field.  Thank you for these gems!

GREAT park. Man, City of Raleigh did good planting these flowers here. When we visited, there were so many people there taking pictures and just enjoying the scenery. We saw a ton of bees, which is one of the best reasons to see these flowers in bloom! Thank you, City of Raleigh.
Beautiful flowers, good for picture taking. Family friendly, but don't come on a hot day!

Always a destination worth visiting in late summer. Love these huge fields of happy flowers :) great photo opportunities. 
This field is part of Dorothea Dix park which is North America’s largest green space inside city limits! Events are happening here all the time. Art, music, food, etc. Definitely worth stopping by.

name: Yates Mill Museum Entrance
address: 4620 Lake Wheeler Rd, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews: Great walking trail around the lake. Feels like you are further away from the city. We saw a deer which was a treat for us. The falls near the mill are really nice too. I would go back there for sure if I come to Raleigh again.

Beautiful place! Can be tricky walking for little ones with large rock areas that can be a little slippery. The tour was fun. Buys place on the weekends around the fall due to family photo taking. Otherwise a great place!
Beautiful trails and really cool bridge. The mill is in great shape.
Was a awesome piece of history,  and it get to wander around on your own at you own pace.
Beautiful Mill and really nice indoor museum with tons of great information and things to see from the area.

name: Glenwood Grill
address: 2603-151 Glenwood Ave, Raleigh, NC 27608, USA
reviews:
I came here Monday with my guy. We googled a few places and wanted to try a place new to both of us. We made reservations weeks in advance and figured because it was a Monday it would be chill. Nope. We were wrong. 
The restaurant has dining and a bar area and it is small. It’s also very loud. I’m surprised by the amount of people they are able to fit. We arrived on time for our reservation and waited for about 10 until someone acknowledged us. It was the bartender and she only stated someone would be with us shortly. We waited a few more minutes and one of the servers came over and asked for our names and stated they would get our table ready. Since the restaurant was packed I understand running behind but it’s still a bit annoying because a reservation was made. 
The menu is small and not many options. Our server was polite and very busy. Since the restaurant was so loud we had to raise our voices to talk to each other but once it started to clear out it was fine. There is not a lot of space between the tables so there is limited privacy. 
Our food came out fine and we both really enjoyed the salmon.

Very nice experience last night. We were greeted and seated promptly. Our waitress (name?) was very friendly and personable. Food was delicious. Seafood (shrimp and scallops) and grits are in the top 3 best I've ever had. Very tasty sauce and drops of blue cheese comes with it. The chef even allowed us to order things that weren't specifically on the menu. Atmosphere was calm, low-lighting, and peaceful. I would recommend this restaurant to others.
Really good food. Great atmosphere. Great service. Variety on the menu and they will always surprise you with soup and dish of day.
Lowcountry in the heart of Raleigh says it all! The food here is amazing. Chef John Wright is outstanding. Highly recommend dining here!

A great restaurant with an excellent atmosphere. The service was also nice. This was my second time visiting the Glenwood Grill and the food did not disappoint. Everything was perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection!

name: Second Empire Restaurant and Tavern
address: 330 Hillsborough St, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews:
Amazing place!!! Made are night perfect! Will 100% go back.
Great place to go on a date night. Very romantic setting. 
It is pricey but worth it.
The service was amazing. Everyone went above and beyond to make it a great time. Food is delicious. Its very fresh. Loved the cheese plate.
I would recommend making a reservation.
They do have a spot for large groups. 
They do have parking, but its not a lot.
 If you get a chance you should go.

The food is superb, the ambiance is magical, and the staff delivers the highest level of service and courtesy. We celebrated a special occasion around the chef's table which was impressive on all facets: four extraordinary courses, perfect wine pairings and an amazing "reality show" from the highly skilled kitchen team. Highly recommended.

It's rare I post reviews after only going somewhere once, but this place was that great. I had the paella, which was fresh and delicious. The dessert, a butterscotch cake with butterpeacan flavoring and citrus reduction was made in house by their pastry chef and out of this world.  Would happily go back. Service was on point.

Great service. Great food. Wife and I had a marvelous time. Too expensive to come often, but worth the special occasion spend. Only detractor was my drink could have used another shot of bourbon to balance the other ingredients. If you like bourbon, just get bourbon and skip the cocktail.

Amazing. Bar staff were on it and made great beverages.  The hostesses were accommodating while we waited. The wait staff was on point. Jason was exceptional along with the others assisting him. Really made the dining experience one of the best.

The food was delicious. We all had something different and stole bites from each other. We also had 4 kids in tow and the chef was able to pull something together too keep them from turning into crazed animals. Another bonus point for them.

If you haven't tried Second Empire, you are missing out. We will certainly return and we urge others to try it out, I cannot see how someone would be disappointed.

Hats off to the chef and wait staff. Thanks.

name: Brewery Bhavana
address: 218 S Blount St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: I had the most amazing experience   here tonight. This place is breathtaking. A bookstore, a flower shop, a library, a restaurant  and a brewery all in one... I must be dreaming! The stage is set, the lighting is in place, the props are in up, the staff is the gorgeous cast and you are the AUDIENCE. Austin is your tour guide to not only to a magnificent scene but also a delectable meal or drink with a view of the marble bar. He will have you intrigued and eventually addicted.

Great atmosphere and a cool little store in the middle of the restaurant! Awesome taproom area with a ton of selection. This place is always busy so best get a reservation asap.

The peking duck was quite pricey but absolutely delicious! Cooked perfectly, with a generous portion, and amazing presentation! The sides with it, I felt, did not do the meal justice. One side, plain dough pieces, are completely without flavor, and there was so much of it! My guess is that it's on purpose to eat with the main dish, while not taking away the duck flavor. Tradition-aside, it's time that item evolved IMO. The scallion pancake app is amazing though. My dog is loving the femur bone the dish came with as I write this!

Service was a bit slow for refills, but was  friendly & helpful otherwise. This was our first experience. We were slightly underwhelmed, but it had been quite hyped to us for a while so we had some crazy expectations. We'll likely be back, but with the prices, might be a little bit.
Walt staff is exceptional!!! Very helpful with first time selections. Food is fresh and flavorful. Liv (our server) was very delightful. Definitely a repeat visit is in order. Awesome food.

I stopped in for lunch shortly after they opened and was seated right away. My server was very friendly and knowledgeable, and helped me narrow down a few options that I had trouble deciding amongst. I ordered the Pork Ma-Po Tofu, as I was looking for something savory and spicy. It did not disappoint when it came out shortly after. Tons of flavor, just the right amount of heat, and a generous portion. Good food for a reasonable price in an nice setting (there’s also books and flowers for sale here). I’d come back again to try some more of their varied menu.

I know this place is rated as one of the top restaurants in Raleigh however being as I’ve traveled around the world this place is just OK. Some of the food can use a little bit of improvement in flavor and texture. Overall, the place is unique for its atmosphere and beer on tap. I believe the best dish that I’ve ordered there, so far, is the fried rice.

name: Beasley's Chicken + Honey
address: 237 S Wilmington St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: Wonderful little place. I would describe it as cozy, borderline intimate, with the waitstaff acting as if it's day one of being open. That's not a bad thing either, as they were incredibly friendly and not overly so. Ordered the fried chicken and waffles, and was thoroughly impressed. The pimento mac-n-cheese custard was also great. Did not try the bar, although it appears to be plentifully stocked with a good cocktail menu to go with it. Overall, a good place to grab a bite to eat, whether alone or with friends.

Amazing food and dessert.  I had the Classic Chicken Sandwich that comes with shredded lettuce, special sauce, and on a potato bun.  Another crowd favorite is the pimento mac 'n cheese. They were both very delicious. Creamy red velvet cake, real banana pudding, and chocolate chess cake we're also had by our group. All 3 were so delicious.  Can't wait to go back.

A Raleigh must if your only visiting for a little. Some of the best friend chicken I've ever had. They serve other good dishes as well. I had catfish here once. It was nice. The Carolina reaper hot chicken is p hot but v worth the challenge for the taste. The taste. It's good taste. Love the taste. How much taste. All the taste. So taste. Have a taste.

I ordered our meal for takeout and the staff was helpful when I arrived. The food came out shortly afterwards. We had the hot chicken sandwich with pimento mac and cheese and the meatloaf with mashed potatoes and green cabbage slaw. Both meals were amazing with an array of flavors and textures. The portion sizes are realistic. The only downside is the price portion ratio is off compared to what we're used to seeing.

The (what seems like) perpetual line out the door should be significant proof that this place is legit. This is a great choice for a casual bite for even the pickiest of eaters. They have phenomenal sandwiches (hot chicken, classic chicken, veggie), awesome sides (mac, greens, biscuits) and the best banana pudding. My go-to fave is the chicken and waffle with a side of the hot oil that they use on the hot chicken sandwich. That paired with a little drizzle of maple syrup is literally heaven on earth! Casual, affordable and quick (aside from the waiting in line on a busy day).

name: Poole's
address: 426 S McDowell St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: Always a favorite. You need to show up about 20 minutes before they open and get in line. If the line is less than 30 people or so you are probably going to get a table. If not, they have a really cool bar reminiscent of an old soda fountain ... but with cool adult cocktails. The menu is ever changing and fresh. Have had dinner here about 4 times and have loved every one. The roasted chicken was amazing and they had a meatloaf that also was the bomb. But with their format, very difficult to predict what they will have week to week. Just know it will be excellent!

I've been wanting to go to Poole's for years and finally got the chance. Poole's is an early one of chef Ashley Christensen's restaurants in Raleigh, and it deserves its reputation. The interior is cozy, dimly lit, and looks like it could once have been a diner. But the service and the care taken in preparing the food bring to mind fine dining not the local greasy griddle.

Food is upscale seasonal southern, with a relatively small, focused menu. The waitstaff and bar staff are relaxed but professional. The macaroni au gratin is deservedly famous: first, it is huge. Second, it has a wonderfully crisp top and smooth, complex cheesiness underneath. I also loved the avocado salad. Doors open at 5:00 and the first seating is at 5:30. Arrive early and have a drink. I enjoyed a cocktail and saw a well-balanced and interesting beer list. There are extensive wine options, though I'm not sure how many are available by the glass; many of the bottles were $50+(++).

The first seating fills up quickly, though we arrived around 5:25 on a Saturday and still managed to get seats at the counter. The main dishes took a pretty long time to come out, but I didn't mind as the atmosphere was relaxing. While it is possible to keep costs down somewhat at Poole's, for most of us it will be a special occasion sort of place when you are prepared to splurge on an experience you'll remember. Well worth it.

As it has been every time we go, the dinner was excellent! This place is a must eat when in Raleigh. You should definitely call ahead to figure out the time for your party to eat there. The dinner is served as a main dish per individual and all sides are served family style. I would sides the Mac and Cheese.

Now the food itself was EXCELLENT. They have an all you can eat snack bar with a large variety. But if you're wondering about the meat, all I can say is everything was FANTASTIC. Every meat was tender, juicy and full of flavor! My favorites were the Sirloin, Tri-tip and Fillet Mignon. Overall my experience here was wonderful and I plan on returning in the future, highly recommend :)

Southern comfort food elevated and served with charm. I have not had the opportunity to go to Poole's in a long time. It was even better than I remembered. 
It was Sunday night, so roasted chicken was what we needed. The chicken was perfectly tender served over perfectly smooth and creamy mashed yukons. The reduced sauce was amazing.
Our appetizer was an unexpected treat. It was lump crab salad with a generous portion of avocado and cornbread. The cornbread had aged provolone which made it even better.
They have a good wine selection at various price points. The menu also has options at different price points too.

name: 42nd Street Oyster Bar
address: 508 W Jones St, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews: Excellent food and service. Got a main course an appetizer and about 18 clams. It was awesome. Shucked the clams right in front of me. Sit at the oyster bar if you can. 5 stars will return. $$$$$

The BEST hushpuppies I've ever tasted! The food is fresh, delicious, savory, flavorful, lively. You gotta try the pimento cheese oysters. There isn't anything negative I could say about this place. The waiter and cooks friendly, engaging, and made great recommendations from the menu and places to visit around town. Its busy so make reservations for groups.

Had an amazing brunch here. The chicken n biscuits with gravy topped with a medium over easy egg was delicious. The shrimp and grits was also terrific 👌. The staff was also on point, very helpful, and accommodating. A+ in my book. They have some awesome Bloody Mary options here as well.

This was my first visit to the restaurant and I loved it!! The food and the atmosphere was great.  The live band playing great music! We had a large party so the waiter was on point with our orders. Also brought out some key lime pie cheese cake for my daughter birthday. I can not wait for my next visit!

My first time here and everything was amazing. Our service was phenomenal! Our server Michael was so friendly and knowledgeable and an overall gentleman. The food was delicious but it did take a while to come out so dessert was on the house. I would definitely recommend and would be back.

name: Sitti
address: 137 S Wilmington St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews:
Thank you so much for the delicious meal. We got the falafels & trio-dip and Kafka kabob... & can I just say wow. We’ve been to the restaurant a few times & were worried the food would taste different when it came to delivery. However, that wasn’t the case. It was excellent and exactly want we needed. Thank you so much for the kind note as well! This is an exceptional local restaurant! 

Also, the baklava was superb!

Definitely best place to have dinner in town. This is the best Lebanese restaurant I’ve ever tried, everything was so delicious, specially the date with bacon, the rice with chicken an de meatballs with yogurt. I really enjoy the dinner but you have to make a reservation because the place is always very crowded.

Came here for our anniversary dinner one Saturday. It was really excellent all around. Our server, Matt, was really helpful. Really liked the atmosphere. All the food was so tasty. Best tasting kibbeh I’ve had. The Lebanese wine was also very good. Paired perfectly with our meals. Busy place I recommend making a reservation.
I am so impressed! Food was fresh, flavorful. It’s a nice and chill environment and the food presentation was beautiful. This will be my go-to place when in Raleigh !

Downtown Raleigh has really become a great foodie area and Sitti is one of the reasons.   A Lebanese style restaurant with a nice long bar and a nice staff.   A wide variety of appetizers, entrees, and desserts.   All of which are good.  Easy to see right off of South Willmington Street.   Clean facilities.   Reasonably priced.   Credit cards accepted.   We will most likely be going back.

name: Seasons 52
address: 4325 Glenwood Ave, Raleigh, NC 27612, USA
reviews: Met the nieces for late lunch and shopping. I like that the restaurant is seasonal, they tell you so you don't expect something to be on the menu next time and it's fresh.i was so hungry I for got pics of the food. The artichoke and spinach dip was excellent... also had tomatoes in it and wasn't the normal creamy... more of the veggies and chunky. They make the mozzarella in house which was good on the lobster flatbread. Golden beer salad was good... I knew this but it's not on lettuce. Hailey was a great and attentive server. Been wanting to try the restaurant and it pleased the palette.

It’s got potential but doesn’t quite make it. Missed many details and the food, although isn’t bad, is not that great either. 
Service is ok. 
Place and atmosphere is good.

Just in case management reads this:
-clean under tables and everything else constantly 
-clean head rests and furniture
-dessert display made us feel like you pulled out of a Starbucks pastry display. (Good try though)
-get rid of that chair, who’s sitting there? Yes, it’s convenient to have a chair close by for an extra guest but it looks terrible.
-menus are dirty and stained
-salt and pepper? Really? Classic diner.
-and the toothpicks, wow
Had lunch here because I wanted a good salad. Was not disappointed! BBQ chicken salad and Shrimp Mushroom appetizer. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Felt fancy without costing too much.

Always good!  They really know how to do seafood!  Great ambiance and friendly service.  Menu includes calories of dishes.  Small desserts helps with sweet cravings while keeping calorie intake on check. Recommended

Scallops, Risotto, & Mac + Cheese are all AMAZING! Very good mini desert parfaits too! Nearly immaculate dining room. Prices are rather high. Limited parking. Very slow service. Also, I did see a flying insect multiple times...

name: The Fiction Kitchen
address: 428 S Dawson St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews:
My partners son couldn’t tell his chicken sandwich wasn’t real chicken! 

Delicious food-but be prepared to wait a little, they don’t take reservations, and this place is always packed. They also have homemade sodas- we loved the root beer. Gluten free and vegan options for most items on the menu. 

I couldn’t tell the difference between the dairy pimento and the vegan pimento, save for a little extra spiciness. Will be back!

I am absolutely stunned with how delicious the food is here. Everything is extremely flavorful and perfectly spiced, from the baguette with vegan pimento to the Carolina-style pulled "pork." They source their food locally, with an emphasis on goods from the farmer's market, and you can taste how fresh it is. We will most definitely be back many times.

The food was creative, fresh, filling and good quality! We had the chicken and waffles, the zucchini patties, a house salad, and lemon cheesecake. It was all vegan and very tasty! The service was good and the wait wasn't bad even though it was very crowded!

This was the most epic meal I've ever had in North Carolina. It was incredible! Everything about it. The vegan BBQ dish was incredible. As were the appetizers and Tres Leches dessert. Also be sure to try the house-made root beer. It was next level. I've been vegan for four years and this is the first time I've ever had to stop and question whether the food I was being served was actually vegan or not. It's not that I care. I don't care if my food simulates the non-veg version of the dishes or anything. But they just nailed everything so close to the original. But it was better! I couldn't believe all the flavors. I also loved the vibe, atmosphere, and extremely friendly service. This is definitely one of my top favorite places ever

Been here twice, and both times food and service were phenomenal. We got there about 10 min after they opened and all the tables filled just before it was our turn to be seated. They took our name and number and called when there was a table open. It was great to be able to just go have a drink somewhere while we waited. The pulled "pork" is incredible!! And "chicken" and waffles were impressive.

name: Relish Craft Kitchen & Bourbon Bar
address: 5625 Creedmoor Rd, Raleigh, NC 27612, USA
reviews: This is a not so hidden gem.  The food was beyond delicious.  It was at our table shortly after ordering. The portions are generous.  Best cheese grits I have had in a very long time.  Staff was friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is relaxing and fun. While I don't live be nearby, I certainly will be back.  Definitely a place to bring my out of state family and friends.  (And pick up unique gifts) Only drawback is that I could not stay longer and enjoy more tasty treats.  Bourbon pecan pie was amazing, so much so, I forgot to take pictures.

I bring my out of town friends here and am incredulous when my in-town friends haven't been. We literally can't come here without starting with the Pimento cheese fritters. People always ask what I recommend and you just cannot order anything sub-par on this menu. My personal favorite is the Summer Greens salad on the test kitchen menu. (They had it last year and I was downright depressed when they replaced the menu for more seasonal items) well, it's back and I'm in love. My other personal faves are the Mac skillets, the multi-colored sweet potato wedges, and the panzanella side salad. 

Little known fact, they're incredibly eco-conscious. Local owners caring about composting and locally sourcing is my type of place. We'll be back..as always.

My sweet daughter ADORES this restaurant. Today she got take-out for me as I am 65 and hesitant to get out much with current events. It was absolutely delicious! My daughter said, momma....I am going to order from them alot to keep them in business. She and her husband had their shrimp and grits last night.....she said best ever!!! Their food is superior....you will not be disappointed! Please support this wonderful business.

The food was delicious! Had the Alfredo Mac and cheese, love the skillet. Their fried brussel sprouts are addictive. The banana pudding desert was amazing. Great cooks. Service was great too! Friendly and quick. Definitely coming back to this place, highly recommend. Nice and casual looked like they had a small shop too.

This place defines comfort food. The only issue is having to make a decision on what to order. The Mac and Cheese variations are fantastic. The grilled cheeses have always been spot on. Even tried the country fried steak and was not disappointed in the least. But then they have to throw items at you from the test menu. I don't have a favorite item from Relish because I have rarely ordered the same thing twice. And the same problem occurs with the weekend brunch. Too many delicious options!

name: Bad Daddy's Burger Bar
address: 111 Seaboard Ave, Raleigh, NC 27604, USA
reviews: Very great place! Much better than i expected. Had the Bacon Cheeseburger on Steroids and was not disappointed! Was very tempted to get one of their "Build your own Salads" and next time I definitely will. 10/10 will definitely recommend and come again.

Best burgers ever. I thought I would hate a burger place since I'm so done with burgers, but these burgers (been twice and tasted my husband's order) are fabulous. Good drinks too. Tons of parking. Cool wall hangings. Can't wait until it's warmer to enjoy their patio.
We love Bad Daddy's! The food and service are always great. I highly recommend.
I really enjoy this part of DT (downtown). Not too crowded but close to things. This place was fairly new, so glad we gave it a go.
Be prepared to wait (25 min) service was good. Had the western hamburger with fries. Burger was cooked perfect but the fries was ice cold. Nice atmosphere but it was very cold on the night I visited.

name: Firebirds Wood Fired Grill
address: 4350 Lassiter at North Hills Ave, Raleigh, NC 27609, USA
reviews: Food here is amazing! Really enjoyed the service and the delicious food. Parking in north hills is always a bit of a headache but if you plan for it in advance it’s not too bad! I would highly recommend making a reservation ahead of time if you know when you’re going, especially on the weekends! Overall great experience! Wait staff was very friendly and the food was prepared VERY fast! We’ll definitely be returning!

We had an excellent dining experience here the other night. Our server was attentive and friendly. She took special care of our kids and even surprised them with a treat at the end of our meal. 
After ordering drinks and food, a server overheard us discussing wine so they brought us a menu and helped us decide on the right one. A great dining experience. We will be back for sure.

This was my 4th time visiting Firebirds and as always the food was delicious! Because we visited later this time, the service wasn't as great as it has been but it wasn't horrible. The salmon was flavorful and the loaded potato was great! The meatloaf was was the best I've ever had! Definitely a restaurant you want to try if you haven't already.

We had the best time at lunch today. Our server, Lauren, was fabulous. She was able to answer our questions and make recommendations that were incredible. Her sense of humor was enjoyable and she was readily available to refill drinks. We will come back again and ask for Lauren. Thanks for a great meal.

This is my favorite restaurant EVER!!! I love the food here...it’s super super yummy! Staff is super friendly and helpful... and prices are not bad given the great quality of food and service. Absolutely love this place💯

name: Vivace
address: 4209 Lassiter Mill Rd #115, Raleigh, NC 27609, USA
reviews: One of my favorite Italian restaurants, hands down. The quality of service and food makes up for the price. This is without a doubt the closest I've come to authentic Italian cuisine in America... Even after visiting Italy, this is still my favorite place to go on a fancy date 😍😍 all the waiters are incredibly friendly and go out of their way to make sure you enjoy your visit! I love the atmosphere and environment, well done Vivace, 5 stars all the way!! 10/10 would go again 👍
Great Italian Restaurant in the heart of North Hills. Great food and great service. Upscale restaurant without the upscale price. I strongly recommend. Here is a photo of my ZEPPOLE. 🙌🏻🙌🏻🙌🏻

Great food.  Nice atmosphere.  A well run restaurant.  A great place to relax in the bar area or have dinner in the dining room with your family.  They also have a pizza bar, which is first come first serve, and enjoyable to sit at and have dinner.  We will be visiting again soon.

My wife and I celebrated our 5 years anniversary here and they made us feel very special since we walked in. We got complementary champagne and dessert and the food was extraordinary. Our server, William was an expert at helping us decide what to eat. Overall experience was amazing. Thank you.
Loved this place ....the food was amazing, i visited this place with my friends on my birthday and it was a total bliss. Ganocci and Ravioli was really good and we all loved it

name: Neomonde Mediterranean Raleigh
address: 3817 Beryl Rd, Raleigh, NC 27607, USA
reviews: First time at Neomonde today. I got the 1/2 pita with lamb and sides of Orzo salad and Hummus with pita. I LOVE Mediterranean food and I was so impressed with the large variety of menu items and gorgeous colors of the fresh veggies in the display case! It was difficult to choose, but I loved everything and greatly anticipate returning often. It was a long wait (about 20 minutes) to get my takeout but the service was good and it won’t keep me from going back!

That was so yummy!!! We ate it all! 
Pros, good food. Fresh food. Calming environment. And GREAT dessert. 

Cons, they forgot my order... and my friend had to go to the counter and tell them so they made a new one. Very pricey.

Delicious Mediterranean food in a huge, beautiful restaurant, with super fast and friendly service. The food is the star of the show here: it's absolutely delicious, the portions are large, prices are low, and it comes out lighting fast. We loved all 8 items we tried. The desserts are also amazing, especially the cashew baklava! There is a ton of seating, including an outdoor patio. You'll also find a Mediterranean grocery store attached to the restaurant. Fantastic!
Really liked it here. Easy to order, food comes out fast. We had a lot of questions as it was our first time here and they were very helpful. The food was fresh, tasty and filling.

Neomonde Mediterranean is a nice place to get good Mediterranean food. The restaurant is cafeteria style where you order your food at the counter, pay, find a seat, and they bring you your food.

I got the Pita Pocket Platter which includes half a pita, two sides, and baklava. The pitas are a good size and the platter is plenty of food.

Oh, they also serve fresh-baked pitas which is a nice, tasty treat.

Neomonde has indoor and outdoor seating. Indoor seating is a mixture of tables and booths. The only drawback is the insure seating area can get loud, making it hard to have conversations.

The restaurant also had a small store where you can purchase Mediterranean items, treats, and cooking items.

I will definitely be going back.

name: Angus Barn
address: 9401 Glenwood Ave, Raleigh, NC 27617, USA
reviews: First, this place is huge!!!  But once settled it still has an intimate feel, as it's all sectioned off nicely.  Great food and friendly service.  Oysters on the half shell and their rib appetizers are a must, and of course the steak is the staple here for mains.  I had the beef tenderloin with blue cheese mash potatoes, medium rare beef was melt in your mouth tender, and the mash was a great compliment with the blue cheese.  Overall a fantastic experience and will gladly visit again.

I've been here several times for dates or group dinners as well as once for a wedding at The Pavilion.  Every time has been wonderful, and the private event team was phenomenal at the wedding (the bride's parents were thrilled).  The prime rib rivals the best in the region (as it should for nearly $40), and I love the cheese and olive appetizer.

One of my favorite places EVER.  An iconic Raleigh landmark that welcomes visitors to the Triangle, and welcomes residents back year after year.  I love to sit in the Wild Turkey Lounge and then hit the meat locker patio if it's nice out.  Try the Buffalo Turkey wings and don't miss the Chocolate Chess Pie! And don't forget to take your good luck apple when you leave!

I’m generally not one to leave reviews but I wanted to share about my experience at the Angus Barn last night.  My wife and I had a 7PM reservation and arrived early with the intent to enjoy an adult beverage or two in the upstairs bar.  It was comfortable and quiet so we decided to stay and have dinner there.  Our servers, Deb and Cameron provided exemplary service.  I’m not sure how it’s possible to be super attentive without being overbearing but they pulled it off without a hitch.  The food, as always, was first rate.  But the kicker— early in the evening my granddaughter called to wish me a happy birthday.  Deb and Cameron heard, “happy birthday grandpa!” and made a mental note.  As we prepared to leave I was presented with a cake to take home to celebrate my birthday.  It’s the little things that make a big difference.  Angus Barn never disappoints, and Deb and Cameron put an exclamation point on the evening.

Wow!!!!! I had a wonderful time! It's definitely a one of a kind place. So much character everywhere you look. The Christmas lights were still up and it was beautiful. The food was delicious. I am vegetarian and didn't expect to get so stuffed at a steak house!!! Great service too. I was very impressed with our server. Just an all around wonderful experience. I have never been disappointed with this place.

name: Irregardless Cafe
address: 901 W Morgan St, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews: The food was delicious. It's great that they have a pretty expansive menu to choose from. Everything from vegan to gluten free to meat filled dinners. My husband and I went here for date night and it was yummy. The atmosphere is very relaxed. Every time we have been there has been live music which is nice. I would highly recommend this restaurant. They also do catering for events. I haven't used them for catering but I have been to events that they have catered and I'm never disappointed.

Love this restaurant for the high quality ingredients and gluten free options.  Have always had great experiences dining in.  Called the other day for carry out service while we are under stay at home orders... I asked about kids meals (my kids LOVE eating there), and the woman on the phone said "Yeah, I don't think that's going to happen."  Sounded very unconcerned about fielding orders for families.  I guess they have enough business without us.

This restaurant was great. The service was great and the food was amazing. Reasonably priced food with live music in the background, which adds ambiance sets a relaxing mood. The server Lauren is amazing, she made the experience that much more enjoyable. Very warm, welcoming and helpful! I very highly recommend this place for anyone that lives in or passes through Raleigh! I think most other restaurants should take notes on great customer service from irregardless!

My family really enjoyed ourselves. Everyone was satisfied from the herbivores to the omnivores. The atmosphere and the staff were great and friendly. It's really great to find a place that accommodates many different food choices. The only negative was the parking, but it's downtown, so hey.... We'll be back!
One of my top 5 favorite restaurants in Raleigh! The food here never disappoints! I love the poblano pepper dish. The cheesecake is awesome. They have plenty of gluten and dairy free options.

name: J Betski's
address: 10 W Franklin St STE 120, Raleigh, NC 27604, USA
reviews: Another wonderful meal at J. Betski's. This time it was Saturday Lunch. I have dined here many times since it's conception years ago, and I can't think of any bad meal I've ever had here. Chef really cares about the food. Pairing the unique selection of beer and wine with the food is one of the highlights. Also one of the few authentic Eastern European restaurants in the Raleigh area that I know of. Lunch is just as good as dinner. Service is friendly and helpful. Definitely one of my favorite Raleigh restaurants!

Always an absolutely amazing meal. I've been dining here for 14 years now and I love it as much today as my first visit. Looking forward to seeing the new location. If you want the beat service ask for Trent as he is phenomenal!!

Excellent lunch. Our table shared plates of pierogies, sausages, kielbasa, warm potato salad, krout, and some good beer. Quiet pleasant lunch. Dessert was fantastic... the lavender orange bread pudding is amazing. Good chocolate tarts. Easy parking out front. Only looses a star to a abrupt and somewhat short waiter bordering on outright rude. We will be coming back, but looking for a different waiter.

If you are looking for quality Eastern European food including pirogies, schnitzel, seafood and steak then look no further. Plus, don’t forget the desserts! 😀 The restaurant is small and seating is limited but it is that personalized experience that makes J Betski’s a treat. The staff is friendly and willing to talk you you and help you make the right selection. The only drawback is that they don’t have iced tea at dinner. We will definitely be back... before and after they move due to Seaboard shopping center being repurposed.

The atmosphere was nice and the service was great. for someone who has celiac and his vegetarian, it's probably not the best option. But they did have a fantastic beet salad I could eat, so I appreciated that.

name: Taverna Agora Greek Kitchen & Bar
address: 326 Hillsborough St, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews: Taverna Agora is a really good Greek Restaurant and dining experience. I like being able to eat on the rooftop and having a nice breeze and a great view. There are many different items available on their menu and I liked the variety available. The food here is amazing and well prepared. The service here is attentive and professional and they work for to bring you everything that you need to have the best meal. This was a memorable meal that I really enjoyed.

I've been to Raleigh three times and I've been to Taverna Agora every single time. Hands down my favorite restaurant here. The atmosphere and vibe on the rooftop reminds me of my trips to Greece. The food is authentic and so is the music they play. The drinks are tasty--Greek lemonade is my favorite. I've had everything from the tasting platters with the lamb chops to the shrimp souvlaki. Haven't had a bad meal yet. Will continue to come here whenever I'm visiting!

If you like Greek food, Taverna Agora is a must.  Great food and well presented.  Courteous and knowledgeable staff and the best patio seating in the entire city.  Great place for meeting friends or a date.
I was pleasantly surprised how amazing my food was. I got the surf and turf and my husband got the lamb chops. Both dishes were delicious.

What a nice place, excellent food, atmosphere, and service. And the breads are fantastic. Wish I would remember the server's name, but very professional, swept-back red hair and arm tattoo. Why it took us so long to finally go there I'm not sure, but we will definitely be back. It was a really good experience.

name: Winston's Grille
address: 6401 Falls of Neuse Rd, Raleigh, NC 27615, USA
reviews: I stopped in here with a business associate/friend for a lunch meeting. And what can I say it was awesome. We came around 1 and there was no waiting and we were served quickly. The restaurant was super clean and the staff was very friendly. I ordered the New Orleans Gumbo Soup bowl and my friend ordered a quesadilla plate. The food was delicious and we were both very pleased. I highly recommend this place if you're in the area and you're looking for a nice restaurant to stop in and talk and chat while you eat a good meal. The ambient environment there is very friendly and relaxing, the service is great, and the food is delicious so you can't go wrong. 👍
We had a large party and the service was excellent. We split multiple appetizer varieties and all were good.  Everyone was pleased with their entree.

Best restaurant in Raleigh hands down. Service is excellent. Their meals always over deliver. I had bone in pork chop with a barbecue bacon sauce, side of green beams and sweet mashed potatoes.Excellent
You will never be disappointed with the food regardless what you order.  Great service.

Excellent service, great food, pleasant environment. This was my first visit and they showed and proved. Both my wife and I were extremely pleased. I had the pork chop with mashed sweet potatoes and green beans. She had pan seared catfish and fried shrimp, collards and creamy mashed potatoes. Excellent meal choices for a first visit...

name: David's Dumpling & Noodle Bar
address: 1900 Hillsborough St, Raleigh, NC 27607, USA
reviews: Environment is excellent because of the historical building structure and old fashioned decoration, Food was so so, believe me, like most P. F. Chang’s, they are using similar ingredients: soy sauce, sugar and syrup.
I love this place. The food is so good and fresh! One of my favorite places to eat in Raleigh.

This used to be my favorite Chinese restaurant. Unfortunately over the years it has declined steadily. 

Way back you got two big egg rolls with most entrees. Then it was one. Now it's one small one. 

My go to dish is Spicy cashew chicken. I also say "as spicy as they can make it". The ticket said "VERY SPICY". 

When I ordered yesterday there were barely any cashews and it wasn't even mildly hot. 

Sad to lose such a great spot. 

Update: now they think posting anti-Trump memes on their Facebook page is appropriate. 

I'm out. No more mild cashew chicken for me.

Love this place. David's is just great. The food is great, prices are great, and it's almost never too crowded despite the quality. We get take out often and eat in several times a year. Laid back, no pretenses, easy to pop in or good place for a casual date. Highly recommend.

Great location Amazing food & Wonderful service! This place hit it out of the park.  Our server Ian was informative, he explained different menu items to us.  He was thoughtful closing blinds without us asking,  it was neat sunset.  He also offered a kids cup and various other things to assist with our toddler being present.  We loved the food and will definitely be returning.  🥰

name: State Farmers Market Restaurant
address: 1240 Farmers Market Dr, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews: This place had some of the lightest fried chicken I ever had! It was so crispy and well seasoned. I loved the mashed potatoes and gravy and biscuits. The biscuit was so soft and buttery. The food was so good and the farmers market that's located there was so nice to see. It had many vendors and people from the community. The staff of the restaurant was really nice and made the experience a lovely one!! Cannot wait to go back when I'm in Raleigh again!!

This is second to none, the breakfast is always great and it's just like being at grandma's. They make you feel right at home and they are very accommodating. I was there two years ago for my mom's  birthday  and we got everyone in the restaurant  to sing happy birthday to her, not to say pay back is pay back this morning  the staff all came by our tab3 to sing happy birthday to me. But still this is a great restaurant for breakfast and lunch.

This is one of our favorite places to eat breakfast! The food is consistently excellent. The staff is always quick and friendly. It is a little loud when crowded but they do open early. Love the location next to the market. It is a great location for a Saturday morning outing.

The North Carolina State Farmers Market is a great place to enjoy fresh flowers, produce, plants, and other local products. It's also home to this wonderful restaurant featuring traditional southern food. There is another restaurant with seafood that is just as good. If you were in the area permanently or on a visit it will be ashamed to miss this.

Average food.  Servers were polite but slow.  This place has a great location next to the farmer's market.  Parking is very easy as there's a lot of parking spaces. Decor and atmosphere is cool. There's a big wooden boat, a life size statue of a horse, a bunch of colorful animal statues, and a carriage. When I thought about it, the best parts to this restaurant have nothing to do with the food or the service which are just average

name: The Capital Grille - Curbside Takeout & Delivery
address: 4242 Six Forks Rd, Raleigh, NC 27609, USA
reviews: It was my first time there and the food was simply delicious. I had a server named Christian, she was a delight... Very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. Her bubbly personality made the experience even more enjoyable.

I have been always looking for a perfect dried age steak experience, and luckily The Capital Grille was the best choice, i would say the steak looks it came from heaven...cooked perfectly and the taste was powerful. The soup and the appetizer were great as well, definitely i will put it in my top list!!!

#1✨Experience!!

We went in last night to celebrate our wedding anniversary and everything was perfect!!  We were greated with a decorated table, excellent service, very polite hosts and staff.  Food was amazing! 
The Capital Grille was by far the BEST choice for our anniversary dinner date!!  Thank you!

This is as top notch restaurant. Went for a business dinner, a group of 8, and it was amazing. I had the best oscar style fillet I have ever enjoyed. The staff and service is superior. Very fancy but relaxed. Lobster Mac and their spin on Crab Cakes is wowing. Everything from start to finish was perfect.  This was my second visit, I went for lunch a few weeks ago and had the burger and truffle fries. That was incredible as well. And DEFINITELY get the calamari.

What a wonderful experience! From the moment we walked through the door, to the time we left to find our car waiting for us mere steps away, everything was glorious. The service? Impeccable. The food? Sublime. All of it was magical. Highly recommended!

name: Caffe Luna
address: 136 E Hargett St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews:
Italian restaurants are difficult to distinguish. Well prepared and flavorful is required to be deemed adequate. Caffe Luna was no different. The menu, while deep in rich and full flavor offerings lacks any daring or originality.  Also missing was any thing demonstrably on the lighter side.

Wait staff was attentive and professional. Hostess served double duty handing out "to-go" orders and, regrettably, took about 5 minutes to recognize, while I was alone, I was  not waiting for carryout and wanted a table.

The room feels big, to big. The high ceilings, with nothing to bring the scale down, is an architectural miss. It lack any intimacy or warmth that is part and parcel with the bbn Italian dining experience.

The four stars is hard earned, and not to be taken for granted.

Finally got around to eating here after living downtown for a few years! And we were really impressed, not only with the food but with the service. We enjoyed meeting the owner, who was very welcoming and friendly. The tomato sauce was the best I’ve ever had, and my two picky kids loved it too. Lasagna was especially delicious and the desserts were delicious as well. I thought the prices were very reasonable for the quality of the food, not to mention the baskets of fresh Italian bread they provide you. A great visit all around!

Cafe Luna is very nice! From the atmosphere to the staff this restaurant speaks class! Great beer and wine choices (they do not have a full bar). Their food is unique and delicious with generous portions! Great date spot, business meeting dinner place, or family dinner restaurant!

Absolutely outstanding service! HIGHLY RECOMMEND for lunch. Most of their lunch pasta dishes were only $6.95. and you get a great portion! The food was amazing, reminded me of Italy. We went for lunch and got there about 1:45 (they close at 2:30pm until dinner), we were seated and had about 2-3 different people who would get drinks, take orders, check in on us. The cheesecake was delicious!
Always enjoy eating here  Food is delicious with unique selections. Staff is attentive but not intrusive. Great wine selection. Great place for a date night.

name: Gravy
address: 135 S Wilmington St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews:
Gravy is great, unpretentious Italian food, friendly service, served in a warm, comfortable atmosphere. Located in the middle of Raleigh, near hot spots and parking, so its convenient as well.

Good selection of wines. Their bread is to die for, so get a few rolls to nosh on and enjoy a glass of wine. I had the chicken parm but next time I'm getting those meatballs. There are vegetarian options as well. The service was quick and friendly. Really an enjoyable eating experience.

Phenomenal Food! Wow! Such a great location! We sat at a high top next to the window and had a great view of all the goings on and so many good tastes coming at us! The risotto balls were so unique and flavorful! The mozzarella plate was fantastic but almost could have been added to the desert menu with a little more presentation of fig and some green apple. The shrimp scampi risotto was perfect! The texture was fantastic! The short ribs were perfect with aIdente vegetables in the ragout! We look forward to the next visit!
One of the best Italian food I have ever eat in U.S! I am not an expert, but let me tell you, you will be amazed! And the staff is a little bit shy but take good care of you.

Nice staff. Eggplant pie was light, meaty and crisp. The chopped Italian salad was adequate.  Wine list is American and Italian of respectable depth and reasonable prices.  Garlic and butter knotted bread rolls are a nice touch to complement the  red sauce "gravy". All in all a nice place.

We went yesterday for TRW. We had a party of six. Hailey was our waitress and she is top notch. It is rare to go out and get both great service and great food but thankfully yesterday nailed both. The food was delicious and the portions perfect. My Old Fashioned was spot on. I had the eggplant pie and my husband had the Gruyere Ravioli. Both were spectacular!  A nice, unique gem of wonderfully rustic Italian. My Papa is from Italy and I can’t wait to bring him next time he is in town! Thank you for a wonderful meal and outstanding service. Hailey, you made us feel at home. Thanks again. We will be back.

name: Bloomsbury Bistro
address: 509 W Whitaker Mill Rd, Raleigh, NC 27608, USA
reviews: Always love sitting at the bar, fine food, great drinks and awesome conversation with the guys. Sadly, won't be doing that for a little bit, so we ordered take out and it was great. The food was wonderfully prepared as always and the 1/2 price wine was a gem.  We're ordering again very soon!
Loved it! Can't say anything more! Great service and wonderful food. Loved to sour dough bread too! Waitress gave some to take home, which I enjoyed for several days!
We had the family chicken and pasta last night , pick up service, it was fabulous! I highly recommend this restaurant! It was easy to order, easy pick up , lots of yummy food! Support small business!

My experience was great. Service was prompt, food was hot and quick. Overall apart from my main dish it was a 5 star dinner. 

The eggplant was good but I also look at value for quality and I definitely felt like it lacked. All that to be said it was the only entree I tried. The mushroom soup was absolutely delicious. I would go again but it’s not my first pick.

What a wonderful experience.  We first enjoyed Chef Toler’s cooking over 20 years ago and have rediscovered his kitchen this year.  Difficult to select an entree from the menu but those chosen perfectly prepared. Service just right.  Outstanding.

name: Crawford and Son
address: 618 N Person St, Raleigh, NC 27604, USA
reviews: Beyond exceptional! We ordered (literally) everything on the menu and there wasn’t a bite of food that disappointed. Every dish was so thoughtfully designed and carefully constructed; every item on the plate was meant to be there. The drinks were also great, the service was fantastic and Chef Crawford was too nice for words. Best. Restaurant. Raleigh.

Dinner was as good as it looks! 

We started with the compressed watermelon and pappardelle to start - they were both delicious...but the pasta was phenomenal!

For mains we had the short rib and swordfish - both were great and we didn't even need our knives!

We ended with the peaches & cream pie for dessert. 

Overall, one of the best meals we've had in Raleigh. We'll definitely be back!

Outstanding service, outstanding food, very nice decor. Thoughtful menu, all food properly executed, cooked and prepared. The mushroom salad outshines the tartare (both awesome) we are still arguing between the pig cheek or the braised short beef (amazing). The apple crumb will make your eyes roll into your skull. Definitely will be back

First time I was ABSOLUTELY impressed with food from a restaurant. Really upset that I was too full for their dessert, heard their chef is one of the best in the country for pastries.

Also, their drinks were phenomenal, never had anything like it. 

Prices were set perfectly for the value you receive. Would go back again!!
The ambiance, service and food presentation were excellent. The food it self was good but over salted for my taste. I'll be back though to give them another try.

name: Cape Fear Seafood Company
address: 832 Spring Forest Rd, Raleigh, NC 27609, USA
reviews: This place literally has the best seafood ever. The service is amazing too. The hostesses were very kind and accommodating and the server was knowledgeable about the menu. The drinks were fantastic. A little pricey but its worth it.

This has got to be one of my favorite seafood restaurants EVER! 

The wait was an hour and 30 minutes, and it was worth every minute. From the food, the ambiance, to the staff, this place was amazing. Our waitress was pleasant and very helpful. 

Now to the food. Seafood is very easy to mess up or be mediocre at but they got it right on so many levels. The Jambalaya was one of the best I've ever had and I'm from the gulf coast so that says a lot. My friend ordered the Salmon and said it was the best she ever had. The crab dip was amazing and the pitas were to die for. Even the damn water was good. 

Caleb, you guys got a winner here. We will be back with the whole crew!!

I thought the food was really good. The buffalo chicken sandwich was good white meat chicken and was grilled to perfection but could have used a little more buffalo sauce in my opinion. Next time I will know to ask for more. Keith was great at the bar as the take out specialist. He made sure that the orders were correct and complete. Shrimp were fried just right. Really recommend the creamed potatoes as a side. They appear to be legitimately made from scratch and were slightly to the salty side but were delicious.

First and foremost..a reservation is a must...The place is a massive cavern of happy go lucky foodies with smiles on their faces.  the service is great and friendly.  The food is just plain yummy across the board.  The Cape Fear chowder is a must and the grilled shrimp tacos are heavenly.  The muscles appetizer is a bath of goodness.

I was impressed the first time I visited Cape Fear Seafood. After going back several times I noticed the food is only good on certain days of the week. They have at least one really great chef that is exceptional. However  their food is really hit or miss depending on who is back there in the kitchen. Reading through the other reviews, I understand why some people think this restaurant is great and others feel as though the food is bland and just okay. It truly Depends on the chef that day.

name: Bul Box
address: 500 E Davie St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews:
Amazing place. Outstanding customer service, went above and beyond to make sure my meal was safe for dietary restrictions. 

Food was outstanding in flavor, and the delivery came in a wonderful container.

Nice find. Bubble tea...well, smoothie really... And spicy sweet chili wings. They text you when your order is ready so if you need to run out and come back you can. The wait was around the amount of time I would expect. On a Tuesday evening there was no line to order which was nice when you compare it to the other food hall. 

The wings were the right mixture of sweet/savory/spicy and they were all cooked through. They could have been fried harder for my liking but I still enjoyed them. I didn't try the appleslaw but there was a generous portion.

The strawberry bubble slushie was refreshing. I think there were popping bubbles in there but they were all popped by the time they got up the straw.

Just ordered for the first time and had it delivered. Food was so amazing. I had beef bulgogi with 
Kim chi fried race. If you havent already eaten here, you should. Cant say enough about the flavor.

I ordered the teriyaki chicken, it was excellent. I took a picture of the food also but that one didn't turn out. It was so fresh and very tasty. Veggies were fresh and still crispy. Would definitely recommend.

Love. Love. Love.

Good flavor and quality for the price. Not a large variety on the menu, but the boxes are really good. 

Good happy hour spot.

name: The Pit Authentic Barbecue
address: 328 W Davie St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews:
Perhaps the premier BBQ in the area, certainly the place for impressing friends and house guests. Not cheap. The brisket is the best in town. Do make a reservation and take advantage of the valet parking. Parking is not allowed at the shopping center lot across the street; a watchful guard is looking for parties that park and then walk to the Pit. 
Also a fun place for Thanksgiving with smoked turkey, ham and all the trimmings for a fixed price. 
The Pit also has a location in Durham but I liked this one much better.

Very good!  Love getting the biscuits and hush puppies to start.  BBQ is a little smoky, but good flavor.  Love the sweet potato casserole.  The Mac and cheese had a thick top layer that I didn't love, but the noodles were good.  Nice place to visit and then go next door to Vidieri for dessert!
Five stars all across the board! Not a single thing to critique. Staff is excellent food is perfectly seasoned. Atmosphere is clean and open. Very well decorated. Bathrooms smell amazing.

Great atmosphere, fast service, friendly waitress, well groomed. I love that. Food fat trimmed excellent.. Great flavors. We really enjoyed everything. Most certain we will come again.. I had double combo, baby back ribs, brisket so tender, mac n cheese, fried okra fried perfect...

The Pit does everything right. Their wings, Carolina BBQ, brisket, turkey, sides are cooked to perfection and seasoned deliciously. Haven't had anything I didn't enjoy here. Staff are friendly and accommodating, prices are good and portions are more than adequate.

name: Vidrio
address: 500 Glenwood Ave #100, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews: This has been our third time visiting over the past few years. Each time has been a delight. A wonderful place to go with friends who are up for sharing various dishes.

I've visited Vidrio 4 times in the past few months and I cannot wait to go back again. This has become our date night/special occasion spot! 

They have been consistent every visit and I haven't been disappointed by any dish. My favorite dishes are the hand cut fettuccine, grilled octopus, and hanger steak.  Highly recommended checking out Vidrio if you haven't! Excellent service, food, drinks and atmosphere!
Loved it!! I haven't had food this good in very long. Loved each and every meal and the drinks was over the notch!!
What a wonderful place, the drinks are good the food is amazing, my girlfriend and I came here on a date night had an amazing time

Vidrio has outstanding service, amazing food, and a romantic ambiance. From the photos, Vidrio looks beautiful, but no photo can do justice to the mesmerizing multiple story wall of colored glass nor to the hanging ropes. It is the perfect setting to enjoy hand-cut fettuccine and the New York strip steak. The steak was incredibly tender and juicy. Our waiter eagerly offered us a custom cocktail to pair with our appetizer and he gave us the chocolate lava cake as a complementary birthday dessert.

name: Cortez Seafood and Cocktail
address: 413 Glenwood Ave, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews: Great SUN happy hour dollar oysters.  Stop by and check out thr great cocktails.  Menu changes occasionally as well.  Fresh bread with hemp butter was also awesome.

Hands down, Raleigh's best restaurant. Do you see that burger? El Fish Mac! Best GD burger ever. Hand cut fries are outta this world, too. First rate cocktails. Excellent oysters. Try the bread and weed butter. You won't regret it - any of it!

So I hear this place is open during this pandemic and taking orders. Even better when you go to a google and see they are offering this coupon for 20% off. You think great!!!..EXCEPT....when you go to order there is nowhere to put the code...? But the coupon also says to show at the store...but when you do..they decline to accept it. Then since it says u can get a gift card 20% off...so you want to buy that then pay for your food. But again..an excuse is given. There are plenty of places that need our money and support right now. If you are going to offer something. Then honor it. Don’t bait us. I no longer desire to try the food.

This is Raleighs premier up and coming restaurant. Everything is fresh, tons of ingredients picked up from the local farmers market daily,  and the dishes are meticulously thought through.  Cocktails are just as good.  All the employees are pleasant and good at their jobs.  The vibe at the restaurant is fun and unique, I absolutely love coming here.

The food was excellent!  I had the grilled whole snapper, and the flavor was wonderful.  My wife had swordfish, also very good.  Her vegetables were also grilled, her zucchini was almost whole.  It was pricier than I expected, e.g. we had to pay for the little basket of bread, then again it was fresh baked, steaming hot, and served with a special butter.  The menu online didn't include any desserts, but they had a couple, we shared flan.  We sat inside, and it was quite cold, my wife brought a sweater.

name: Mandolin
address: 2519 Fairview Rd, Raleigh, NC 27608, USA
reviews: I have been here twice now and had great service both times which seems like is getting harder and harder to find.  My fiance and I have loved every thing we have ever ordered here.  The food is flavorful and tastes very fresh.  Prices are a little steep for portion sizes but I will pay for an excellent experience.

I loved every second of this restaurant experience. My date and I just couldn't decide so we ordered a little bit of everything. The biscuit dumplings were scrumptious, I especially loved the chicken in the gravy. The trout, oh my God. What a surprisingly delicious meal. The acorn stuffed squash is something I wish I could eat every week after a long day at work, maybe paired with a yummy glass of wine from their amazing list (the unoaked chard was awesome!!) And the chicken & waffles was a unique take on a classic Southern dish. To finish it all off, we shared an order of french press of Pine State coffee,yum! And an order of the apple crisp. Everything was fantastic and I'm excited to have found a new favorite local restaurant, emphasis on the "local!" A standing ovation for Mandolin, what a treat!
Amazing dinner last night with two wonderful people. I had the trout! And our server (I'm sorry I forgot her name!) was great, so kind, professional and caring. Will be back for sure.

This was an amazing dining experience. Our waiter was fun and inviting, knowledgeable and experienced, one of the best waiters I've had in a long time. The dishes won't be forgotten. We had oysters on the half shell as an app, and they were probably the freshest in the city. The drinks are all amazing. This is a must do, but be prepared to pay for that level of service

Just ate there today for brunch. Food was good but service could of been better. Could of got 5 stars but they never brung me and my date our fruit we ordered with our meal. So deep into conversation it slipped our mind and you waiter never once mentioned it. Shouldn’t have tip $15

name: Death and Taxes
address: 105 W Hargett St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: Very nice place with some history behind the place. Food was very good, I had the grilled pork it was very good and had a nice, fresh flavorful, taste. My friend had the rabbit which was also very, very good. It is a higher end place so on the expensive side. Limited beer selection but the food and service are top notch. Our server Selena was very attentive  and knowledgeable about the menu and the history of the place. She was very professional and discussed with us the vast experience of the owner. Very nice experience.

Well no.  This restaurant has the ingredients to be much better, but it misses on the food.  Death and Taxes has a beautifully designed dining area with an open kitchen setting in a historic building.  Thus, you arrive on a positive note.

The kitchen features a wood fired stove which sounds flavorful but failed to deliver.  I ordered the pork chop in medium.  What was delivered was rubbery, fatty and bloody.  We all know chefs like to “flash” cook for flavor, but that is not what I wanted or ordered.  The chop came with “charred” cabbage which had no “charred” flavor.  The entire dish was swimming in the chops juices.  This felt more like amateur hour that a refined chef.  Ironically, the meal took a long time to be delivered, but I am confident it did not spend much time on the grill.  Perhaps next visit will be a better experience.

I am not a fan of all the restaurants under her umbrella, but I can always count on Death and Taxes to come through when entertaining swanky guests. I really like the twice cooked lamb shank. It's a considerable amount of food and I sometimes feel generous enough to share. Lovely muted elegance.

I live in a city with over 11K restaurants. Raleigh has less but let me tell you, if you visit the city, check out Death and Taxes. The food was delicious. Steak wasn’t great but coming from Houston, I won’t judge too hard. The space is small. Very small. We called and still had to wait but happy we did. Great bourbon selection! Like AMAZING! Didn’t see anything on the dessert menu to excite me but still left very satisfied. Well done. Oh, get the roasted oysters!

Fancy dining but also overrated. 

Service was great!  The drinks were excellent. The food was good.  

The highlight was that I asked for a metal straw for my cocktail, on a whim, and sure enough.. they brought me a metal straw!  It really is the little things :)

name: Garland
address: 14 W Martin St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews:
Thought this might be an Indian fusion name as the name of the restaurant sounded Indian. 
But its not. There was one curry option that ccame out without any bread! How can you have the curry only with rice. The taste was OK too. The staff was very courteous and attentive.  Came a couple of times to check if everything was OK and always smiling.

Food was magnificent.
Full of exotic flavors and every dish made a statement!
I normally take pictures of my dishes, but we were very hungry and the plates looked scrumptious so we just dug in and ate. Loved it and will go back again.
The food was delicious and even though the lunch menu is pretty limited, the two orders we placed turned out really good

This place was recommended by a colleague who works around the corner. 
 I had a lunch date with my son on a Thursday during the rush hour.  The serving staff were pleasant, positive, and attentive.  The atmosphere was somewhat too dark.  The food was tasty and fresh with unique combinations of flavors.  The cost was a bit high for the amount of food but organic "yuppie" meals tend to be higher prices.  The lunch menu seemed rather limited.  It's unclear if the theme is Mediterranean, Indian, or eclectic.

One of Raleigh's best restaurants. Bringing together southeast Asian flavors with southeastern US ingredients. Well executed, balanced, and flavored- every dish will knock you out of the park. I particularly recommend the Chicken or Tofu 65, absolutely delicious. If you like seasoning things with ketchup and black pepper only, this isn't your restaurant. Absolutely worthy of a James beard award, would be a Michelin plate if Raleigh was in the guide.

name: Rey's Restaurant
address: 1130 Buck Jones Rd, Raleigh, NC 27606, USA
reviews: The owner Rey, is Fantastic. The entire staff are polite, professional, and personable. The food is wonderful. 5 stars. If your looking for an upscale restaurant, go to Rey's. If you are looking for a place to hold your large gathering, go to Rey's. Eat and drink at the bar, eat outside on their newly built outdoor patio or enjoy your dinner in their lovely dinning room. Either choice is a great experience.

Go here. Fine dining with a different flare than most you've been to. The restaurant is elegant and beautiful. The menu is unique. The story of Rey is compelling. The food we had was top notch. Our waiter, Greg, was very professional and just the right mix of interaction and information. The place is well-equipped for couples, small groups and large parties. We luve in N Raleigh, but we're glad we found this gem in Cary.

So my husband and I love this place. The atmosphere was lovely. The staff was awesome. The food was ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! The chef really put his heart into the food. Everything was flavorful and filling. It was our first visit but we will definitely be back and soon.

Love this place. One of the best Filets you will ever eat. Great service every time. They make special occasions and celebrations even better with special touches. The owner personally walks around to every table and greets you and asks how things are etc ... I highly recommend you go here; I don't think you will be disappointed.

I just wish I could give this place 10 stars. Rey is absolutely incredible. Even in these trying times, he came to our table and cooked bananas foster for us! How many owners do that? Certainly right up there with Angus barn or Ruth Chris, just an incredible dining experience!

name: Bella Monica
address: 3121 Edwards Mill Rd, Raleigh, NC 27612, USA
reviews:
