We recently dined at Bella Monica and it was amazing. This was our first time dining here. I proposed to my future wife and she said YES! The staff was not aware, but when we told our waitress she could not stop congratulating us. Even the staff came to our table and they turned a special moment into and amazing experience. 

The food, the ambience, and the staff combined to make it a perfect night. We will definitely be going back and encourage everyone to add this to your favorite restaurant list. You will not be disappointed!

This was our first visit and I was very happy at the quality of the food. The chef gave a personal touch when he came to the table to talk to us about some of the dishes order preferences. Our table was for eight people so we were a bit cramped in the hallway but it was fine by me. All in all, great food and fantastic service.  Will definitely go back!

Excellent, pricier Italian restaurant with good ambiance and delicious food.

Bella Monica is my go-to restaurant when I'm craving high quality Italian fare. The restaurant's ambiance and atmosphere make for a great date night. Entrees vary in price from $14-20, with good portions that will leave you full but not overwhelmed. They also provide an unique bread dish to start that will leave you full before the appetizers arrive, if you're not careful. Their rotating specials menu always are worth trying, and allow for variety outside of the Italian classics always present on the menu.

Had a wonderful take out meal, during this crazy time Bella Monica provided us with the comfort of a fresh cooked meal from the shelter of our own home. The pizza and stuffed shells were delicious and satisfying. We can't wait to come dine in!

One of the best Italian restaurants in Raleigh. Specializes in gluten free, dairy free, and vegan menus. Fresh ingredients and well cooked meals. Service is excellent and prompt. Portion size is definitely fair for the price paid. Lastly, it gets busy on the weekend so I would highly recommend making a reservation a few days in advanced.

name: Stanbury
address: 938 N Blount St, Raleigh, NC 27604, USA
reviews:
Fantastic spot tucked near town.  From the start the breads and spreads are great. Always order one of their greens/veggies—romaine salad or roasted whatever. (Menu changes) Scallops delicious.  All of their plates we’ve tried have been incredible.  
In fact, I’ll say it might rival these Southern Staples: A sweet HOT Kristy Kreme or the 4 piece Chicken Supreme Combo from Bo’s.  Now if you don’t like those 2: well that’s just plain sad.
Eclectic decor and an eclectic menu make for an awesome dining experience! Food and drinks were perfection. The ribeye was probably my favorite, with the bone marrow coming in close second.

Delicious food and experience. I had the pork chop and my wife had the whole snapper. Everything tasted top notch. The staff is knowledgeable and made some great recommendations including wine and cocktails. Our particular server was friendly and had a great sense of humor. He also surprised our table with some champagne on the house as we were celebrating a birthday. This is not my first visit and certainly won’t be my last.

Not my first time here and it certainly won't be my last.  This gem in the heart of Mordecai rarely disappoints.  A small plates menu that packs a large punch.  And a cozy setting, with an open kitchen. This spot is not to be missed, if you like eating out.  Try the crispy 🐖 head and the 🦆 breast.
My family and I eat here whenever we have the chance! Our favorite restaurant in Raleigh. They are constantly updating their menu, so each visit is unique.

name: ORO
address: 18 E Martin St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: Beautiful and open, albeit loud, space. The menu was varied and interesting, with lots of options for the vegetarians as well as the meat eaters. Loved the pearl couscous and the ribs. Liked the diverse wine list. The key lime mousse for dessert was lovely. A nice treat if you’re in the area.

Took my lovely lady out to this restaurant for Valentine's Day weekend. Salmon, Octopus, Truffle Mac, and Shrimp Tempura were all phenomenal. Glad they encourage sharing. Also, a nice dim lit atmosphere with my kind of music playing in the background. Definitely will be back for more!

I had a great time here with my date last night. There was a 45 minute wait for a table but it was expected for a Friday evening. We waited at the bar and had a stormy mule. They had a lot of specialty cocktails that looked good. We were seated and ended up getting the sesame cauliflower, caramelized pork belly, and parmesan risotto. All of them were amazing! I really liked their family style for eating. They brought out the dishes to our table and we served ourselves onto our own plates. And we only ordered 3 dishes but it was so filling. The atmosphere was so romantic, a little noisy but it didn't ruin the mood.

This place is amazing! Such a great lunch and dinner spot. Today was lunch and I highly recommend the Bento offering. Obviously it changes daily. Today we had the braised short ribs, mixed greens, fingerling potatoes, and an amazing creme brulee cheesecake ALL FOR 
$10. Seriously, that has got to be the best deal in downtown Raleigh.
Also had were a couple scrumptious apps/shareables - Sesame Cauliflower and Asian Brussel Sprouts. Oh my goodness the burst of flavors from these! When you go, do not pass these up!
I had the BBQ Shrimp Tacos! Again, some of the most savory and delicious combinations of flavors that you'll ever experience!
Ask for Hunter when you go! Wonderful server and mixologist 😏
Get the smoked Old Fashioned. You won't be disappointed!

I had dinner with a few friends at ORO for the first time this weekend, and I will definitely be back!  The food and drinks were fantastic!  I especially liked the butternut squash ravioli.  The Bath & Boozy drink was served in a miniature bathtub!  We had great service, and the restaurant has a nice atmosphere.

name: so•ca
address: 2130 Clark Ave, Raleigh, NC 27605, USA
reviews: My wife and I came here on a date night and really enjoyed the atmosphere and the small plates that we can share. Our waiter, Miche, took great care of us and had great recommendations. All of the food was very unique including the drinks. The restaurant itself was fairly quiet with a very upscale atmosphere and not too crowded.

My wife and I recently dined at this fine restaurant just this past weekend. I’m happy to say the food was great. The service was exceptional. Just a small detail, I seem to have this very strange cough after visiting this place which doesn’t seem to go away...

The food was well-presented, creative, and light. Also the space was beautifully decorated. However, the flavors of the food were very underwhelming, especially for the price. There are many places in Raleigh and Durham to get much higher quality food at a much lower price. I would not recommend this restaurant.

Took my date here on Valentine's Day and it was amazing! First time eating here and will definitely be coming back! I love the atmosphere of this restaurant, and the plating here is so brilliantly done. Madison was also an amazing waitress! Definitely coming back and is easily one of my new favorite restaurants. Until next time!

Danielle. What a superb server she was. I felt like she loved her job. I am vegan and we try to avoid gluten and I was BLOWN away by the food. We ordered 4 appetizers and dessert and two drinks each and a $20 tip and it was about $100.00 and for the experience I had I would have paid $200.00. We ate off the VEGAN menu completely. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

name: Centro
address: 106 S Wilmington St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: We LOVED our lunch! I would recommend the torta to anyone; it was just delicious! The bread was soft, the steak tender - I couldn't have asked for more. The soup is also delicious. I would also recommend the shrimp tacos. We also especially appreciated the great service. We'll be back!

I was not overly impressed but my husband was. It was a little pricey for the quality of food and wine. Nice hip atmosphere. Overall it was good and I would go back to try something else but I can’t rave about this place like some other places I’ve been to. We didn’t make a reservation on a Friday at 615 and there was an hour wait so we sat at the bar. The bar tender was very attentive and helpful.

The food here is always fantastic! You can’t go wrong with any of their tacos. Most days they have lunch specials which are also always worth trying. 
The space is uniquely decorated and has a very eclectic vibe. Table sizes are somewhat limited so if you come with a large party will be difficult to get everyone seated. My latest visit we had six people and we simply sat at the bar which worked out fine. Definitely a local favorite and I’m always excited to visit again.

Incredible atmosphere and delicious food. Had the salmon wrap with beans as a side. She had the steak tacos with the slaw (heads up, it has a bit of a kick - not your traditional slaw). Our server was a peach and we really enjoyed our experience. The bathrooms include extra toiletries and are amusingly decorated as well. Would highly recommend!

Came here on a Tuesday and was immediately impressed by the decor. It was rustic and tacky in a beautiful way, so much fun stuff to look at and the decor gave the restaurant an authentic Mexican vibe. The food was good not crazy good but good. My margarita was another story though. I forget the name but it was the spicy one and the spice was perfect but the after taste was out of this world crazy good! The chips salsa and guacamole were great also the habenero house made hot sauce was incredible.

name: Royale
address: 200 E Martin St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: Delicious restaurant in the heart of Raleigh.  Everything I had was top notch.  Of course, the Brussels sprouts are not to be missed and can be a meal alone.  I am not sure what they added but I could not stop eating them.  My trout included a savory salad and was flavorful.  Dessert with strawberries nicely completed the meal.  Worth a visit in Raleigh.

Very professional bar and table service. Full bar but the menu is limited. The Trout was prepared perfect.the Brussels Sprouts were very good. French flare to everything. 
The Bartender was great.
One of the best meals i have ever had. So happy with this place. Katie was awesome! The beef Wellington was incredible and the s'mores ice cream was the deal sealer!

Great food and great service. We did the "dealers choice" which is their tasting menu. Each plate, 13 in total, was excellent. The total service was about 2 1/2 hours which was enhanced by our lovely waitress Maya. Her enthusiasm for the food was quite notable. I Highly recommend Royale for a special occasion.

Royale is always a treat. Jeff takes great care of us and I'm always pleased with the food, hearty but complex and interesting at the same time. I'm obsessed with the brussel sprouts. Cocktails are great, too. A must hit in Raleigh.

name: Capital Club 16
address: 16 W Martin St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: This super stylish restaurant serves up delicious, European-inspired dishes. They have huge windows and beautiful indoor/outdoor spaces. We love them so much, we feature them on our Raleigh Walking Food Tour.
Great bar and restaurant!  Both the food and drinks were exactly what I wanted.  Staff was good.  Will definitely be back!

We have been to Capital Club 16 for dinner on several occasions and we have never been disappointed. 

Today we decided to go for Sunday Brunch and oh how glad we did. Every offering on the brunch menu sounded delicious. We wanted to taste it all. 

My wife had the Pan seared Salmon. It was Baked salmon, pepper jack grits, roasted tomatoes, sunny side up egg with creamed spinach

I had the Fried egg Florentine. A couple of Sunny side up egg, potato cakes, roasted tomato, mushrooms, fresh greens with a side of Schiller sausage.  I Finished my brunch off with a cup of counter culture coffee. 

The atmosphere is warm and welcoming. Bernard, our server was very nice and made our time at Capital Club 16 just perfect.

We love trying restaurants and getting out of our "box". This was in a very cool older building in downtown Raleigh that had that awesome rustic charm that we never knew was there.  The staff were friendly, the Bloody Mary was just the right amount of spicy and the food was so good we ate every bite on our plates! The dessert of the day sounded so good we had to get one to share.   All in all it was a very nice experience that made us want to go back again.

What an excellent find. Had Sunday brunch. The food was really excellent. We had the German faire. I had the pork schnitzel and it was delicious. My wife had the German platter which included white sausage. Great too. They sell Hofbrau lager on tap! The Bloody Mary was nice and spicy. Our server Glynnis was very helpful and friendly. Very attentive. Oh yeah, the chocolate cake with banana sauce was outrageous.Good coffee too!

name: Parkside Restaurant
address: 301 W Martin St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: The food was really great. The fried chicken gravy bowl, the pork chop, deviled eggs, everything was fantastic. I had my birthday brunch here and am very satisfied with my decision. The food was hot, seasoned, and really good portions. The service was excellent as well. I have to check out their dinner menu next!

4 stars for food. Really enjoyed the deviled eggs, fried chicken biscuit bowl, tomato bisque and BLT. Lacking was service. Waitress took the orders and then different food runners delivered. Had to go out of our way to get a refill of coffee as the appetizer dishes stayed piled on the table. Additional 20 minutes after finishing before the check was offered.

First time here and the meal was very good.  For lunch tried the short-rib stroganoff and the daily special open-faced scallop BLT with collard greens.  Everything was delicious.  Service was great.  Was not too busy at 11 am.  Beer/bar selections looked good (did not try) for my pallet. Will definitely come back again.

Park side is cute diner located in downtown Raleigh. The atmosphere is fast paced, but the service was fairly steady. I think our server had too many tables and that caused him to not be able to dedicate the attention to all of his tables equally. The food was ok. I had the shrimp and grits which weren’t bad, but I’ve definitely had better. I will try something else if I return to this restaurant.

We thoroughly enjoyed Parkside. We chose it because of other reviews and were very happy with our choice. Food was great. I had the Mediterranean Bowl with Salmon. They ran out of salmon so I ended up with shrimp but it was still great. My husband had the stroganoff which was amazing. There were 4 of us and everybody loved their food. I had the strawberry jalapeno margarita and it was delicious. Staff was friendly and very attentive. I drink a lot of water and they kept my glass full. He even brought me a full to go cup when I asked for a little more water at the end of our meal.

name: MOFU Shoppe
address: 321 S Blount St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews:
One of our meals was really good, but absolutely not worth the wait. 

Went for lunch on a Saturday, we were one of 3 tables at the time. It took an hour after we ordered to receive our main dishes. Server was very nice but it just wasn’t worth the hour wait. 

The curry bowl with shrimp was delicious, loved the flavor. My fiancé got the coconut rice bowl with fried shrimp and was “never more disappointed with a meal in his life” he said it tasted like someone just threw the leftovers from their fridge in a bowl. Very little flavor... and this from a man who loves food. 

The space itself was really cute, very clean. Love the decor and urban chic style. Was excited to try but left disappointed... an hour and a half later.

Great place with a menu that is always changing.  Lots of great options and they have great sauces to accent every choice.  If you want heat just ask.  Waitstaff is very professional and will take time to explain the menu.  Great seating options and you can just lounge and sip on your drink while you watch folks walk by.  Who doesn’t love to “People watch”.  Parking can be tricky, but you already know that if your venturing downtown.

Absolutely loved this place. Fantastic service with a server who was spot on and had recommendations immediately (and had actually tried the food). Great variety, drinks, and atmosphere with local art and craft cocktails. Parking is Street or a parking lot around the corner. We had the brussel sprouts / ginger dumpling (small plate) and then entrees of flounder tacos and short rib bowl. My only nib is that the rice was a bit too sweet and the desserts / coffee at the end can definitely be skipped (this is not their forte at all).

Great addition to the Downtown Raleigh food scene! We loved all of our dishes, especially the pork dumplings and the kimchi fried rice balls. We were disappointed they were out of the chicken entree when we had dinner there, and had to get more appetizers instead of an entree. Prices are a fairly high, but quality and creativity of the dishes is solid, and portions are pretty good sized. Love their story from the food truck days, and we had the kindest waitress who we loved!
Followed the waitress' recommendations and liked all!  The Flounder Taco and Sprouts were outstanding.  Great ambiance and parking nearby.  Highly recommended and a must in downtown Raleigh!

name: the Oak, Kitchen | Bourbon Bar
address: 4035 Lake Boone Trail, Raleigh, NC 27607, USA
reviews: I can't remember the last time I had customer service like I had at The Oak. No joke, I was blown away by how pleasant it was. The atmosphere was laid back and the smells, phew that smokey smell from their food radiated through the entire restaurant. My fiance and I made reservations for 2 and earlier in the day, we were contacted by them to confirm our reservations and to ask if we were attending the concert at PNC arena that evening, in which we were. They told us that they would be sure to have us out int time for the show and they were not joking. Our drinks were brought quickly and the same for the food. The timeliness of this didn't take away from the quality though. The shrimps tacos, fries and sliders blew us out of the water along with the stout I was drinking. When leaving, we were told to be safe and to enjoy the concert and that made us smile. They have gained repeat customers for sure.

Enjoyed a very good meal here. Started with deviled eggs and a salad which is easily shared amongst 2 or even more the start. The NY Strip was perfectly cooked and the fish tacos were tasty as well. The waitress we had was impressively knowledgeable about the extensive whiskeys and bourbons that can be enjoyed with a flight.

My husband and I met some friends there last night and had a good time. The atmosphere is nice and we didn't have a hard time finding parking. The menu is a little skimpy. The guys got the sliders and at the price they charge there should have been more than 2. I got the nachos and it was a decent helping. My husband and I bit got the old fashioned and they were good. He got a martini and it was way too salty. It was not good at all. I would say this is a good restaurant, but the prices are a tad high for the menu selection. You will enjoy it if you visit.

nothing special about the bourbon beef burger was nothing special for $13 plus an extra $2 to remove the chips that come with the burger and replace them with regular fries. It tasted like any generic burger and fries. 
for $15 I would prefer something in the quality of Red Robin.
 Great location we sat outside with garden view, very relaxing atmosphere. friendly waiter. 
Not my cup of tea.

Found this lovely restaurant on Yelp and made a reservation the same day (through Yelp) within a few hours of the time frame. When we arrived, the restaurant was busy but not packed to where every single person was waiting. We got there right as our reservation stated and they seated us within 2-3 minutes of arriving. Our waitress was nice and explained about the menu and vibe since it was our first time here. The food was delicious and the service was 5 stars. We weren't that hungry so we just split two small plates and it was more than enough. We also tried a few cocktails and they were just as good. I loved the fact that they offer meatless burger sliders since we are vegetarian and cannot find that at too many restaurants (although it is becoming more popular). I have told many people of this restaurant and will be taking visitors here when they are in town!

Pros:
Meatless/Vegan options
Great service
Layout is nice and relaxing
Seating inside or outside
Great variety of drinks to choose from
Clean bathroom

Cons:
Wish the bar was a tad larger/more seats to welcome guests who want to grab a drink while waiting.

name: Five Star Restaurant
address: 511 W Hargett St, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews: Five Star Restaurant offers delicious Taiwanese and Chinese cuisine with a fun, industrial atmosphere. Their bar and pool table are perfect for happy hours! We love Five Star Restaurant so much, we feature them as part of our Raleigh Walking Food Tour.
We've been coming here since this space was Wicked Smile. The BEST sesame beef ever. Great bar too.

Cute,  trendy spot in the warehouse district downtown Raleigh.. the shrimp fried rice was excellent,  service okay.  The drinks were really good,  but it seems the only way to know about this place is word of mouth.. there is no visible sign outside to indicate it's existence. Nonetheless,  great place to chill and eat and I'll be back.

I liked the place. However, I think they need to upgrade their location a bit. We sat right next to the wall with the holes in it. Other than that, it was nice. Atmosphere there is also very good and friendly.

I came here on Saturday for my birthday celebration with 3 of my friends and it started of really rocky. I am not sure if the lady with the short hair cut is the hostess who took us to the table but she had a horrible attitude that almost ruined the night.  I requested to be at a table in the corner so that my friends and I did not disturb the other guests because I knew we would be laughing the night away, it was met with eye roll, smacking her lips, a smart comment under her breath, and she also poured everyone else water except me.  I was very disappointed in her behavior and how she represented the establishment.
That being said, our waitresses Brittany and then Sam were phenomenal! They really helped make the rest of our time there a success and for that I am grateful and appreciative! First and foremost she provided me with the water that I know the other lady intentionally did not pour.  She had a thorough knowledge of the menu which she used to provide suggestions on appetizers, sake, drinks, and entrees.  We took her recommendations and our food was absolutely delicious! Amazing flavors and huge portion sizes. 
Hospitality is such an important part of the dining experience, it is a shame that I spent the first 15 minutes focused on how nasty the first lady was and trying to decide if I wanted to celebrate elsewhere because who wants to be greeted in such a negative manner, especially on their birthday?

name: Bida Manda Laotian Restaurant and Bar
address: 222 S Blount St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: We got lucky to get reservation when we did. Usually you may have to plan to go here but off chance you get a table. Food was good the cocktails were great. Highly recommend the papaya salad, totally different. Great ambiance and our server was great.  Four star based on value and taste.

Flavor on top of flavor!! Sausage is out of this world.  I’ll dream about that.  Story basil looked and tasted like freshly picked vegetables.  The vegetables were so good, I didn’t notice the beef.  Poached egg was a really nice surprise!

Amazing food! There is nothing on the menu that I didn’t like. I came here for a staff dinner and were all got to try a little bit of everything - and everything was DELICIOUS. Waitress was fantastic and very helpful on any food allergies at the table. I’ll definitely be back!

One of the best restaurants around and their staff is always accommodating and helpful. Great place to come to if you have an allergy just let them know. 

I recommend the pork belly soup and chicken wings.The chicken wings are among my top 3.

Only downside is that they do run out of chicken wings and it is soul crushing :(

The wait was long over one hour but it was well worth it. The dining atmosphere is inviting. The servers are attentive. The food was delicious. I mean it was really tasty and savory. It was presented well and served at the right temperature. I had the spring rolls, papaya salad, and pad Thai. 

I will definitely return when I come back to Raleigh. Make sure you reserve ahead of time.

name: N.C. Seafood Restaurant at the Farmers Market
address: 1201 Agriculture St, Raleigh, NC 27603, USA
reviews: Literally the best place to get seafood. Literally. Why bother going anywhere else unless you want a waiter to serve you? Price point/quality/portion is insanely valued above average. Price is so cheap for the quality of food and huge portians. Can't beat it anywhere else to my knowledge and it's worth the drive. Right off the highway. Great location.

All I can say is wow!  If you love seafood, this is the hidden gem of Raleigh.  Great food.  Great prices.  It's so good that you don't mind that it's served in a to go plate and it's a good thing that it is served that way because if you're not starving when you start you're definitely going to take some home with you.

I'm here now and just had the lunch special shrimp. Man when I opened up the top of my tray the steam just shot out the top. Now you know that's fresh and it was. I had to ask for forgiveness because I ate every bit of it. The portions are huge and well worth the money. When I want fresh hot seafood this is the place to come. I will be back.

really good food. Fresh fish and shrimp. Not too overly seasoned so the freshness of the ingredients shines through. Service was really fast. The place is crowded but that adds to the rustic environment. Portions are large and totally justified by the price.

Awesome place. It’s a very busy place, but they are one off the best seafood places in Raleigh.
They have outdoor and indoor seating areas. 
The waiting time is between 5 to 10 min. 
After you do your order they give you a number  and they will call your N when it’s ready.
This  was my first time ordering soup, it was excellent I will order it every time we go there.
We got 3 orders. Shrimp, scallops and 2 soups 🍜. 
Yummy yummy yummy. 
We really loved it, this place will  be our favorite seafood place ever.

name: The Station at Person Street
address: 701 N Person St, Raleigh, NC 27604, USA
reviews: We had a fantastic lunch at the Station. Katt was attentive and friendly. We ate outside and the kids loved the patio. They have fans and the patio is mostly shaded. There is indoor seating as well. The food was delightful and the beer list was nice and varied.

Went on a week day for lunch and I️t still had a good crowd. Great outdoor seating! Welcomed by a lot of friendly faces who were very attentive and readily there for you. We were new to Raleigh and they made us feel welcome. Great quality food and good beer menu! Highly recommend for a nice lunch.

Great place to visit for a lazy Sunday afternoon. As you can probably discern from the name of this place it's an old gas station great bones to the building, cool nostalgic place to eat. It has a nice outside dining area and a super cool bar. It also has a nice bar on the inside ample seating at both the bar and inside dining with a few TVs and probably 10 to 12 draft beers. I had the sloppy joe with pimento cheese and homemade chips, really super good!!! My wife had the Pickled beet and goat cheese salad  with chicken, which was equally as good.

Enjoyed some drinks at the outdoor bar before heading to dinner. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable.
There’s a lot of great outdoor seating with plenty of room indoors as well. A unique space and set up. Looking forward to coming back and trying food soon. Great location.

Great spot! Glad we stopped by - amazing deal on the salmon blt (so much salmon). Everything was great - bacon habenero pimento cheese dip with pita, sloppy joe with pimento cheese, carrot cake.

The bartender was awesome and versatile. Got some hot toddies here (not on the menu) and they were amazing - especially on a cold night sitting at the outdoor bar. Friendly staff.

name: Assaggio's Italian Restaurant
address: 3501 W Millbrook Rd, Raleigh, NC 27613, USA
reviews: I have been eating at Assaggios for over 10 years now.   They're the best. Hands down.   Please consider trying them if you haven't already.   This is one local business that has earned its place in  our community.   We love you guys

1st visit ordered on line through slice. Let's say these wings were almost as good as the ones back in Upstate NY. My only request next time is the wings be fried little crispier. Also had the antipasto salad and that was delicious as well. Order was ready when I arrived to pick it UP. No issues. Will definitely be back for dem WINGS!!

Happy with my Assaggio’s experience so far! Their meatball subs are amazing, and the baked ziti and lasagna are tasty as well. They deliver through Postmates too which is very convenient. I will definitely order from them again!
Authentic Italian food!! This is my go to place since I moved to Raleigh. Great sauce too.

Fantastic food! Beautiful design. Loved the prices. My favorite part was it wasn't overly loud! Nothing worse then going to have a nice quite dinner with the husband and the music is so loud you can't hear them

name: Tazza Kitchen Cameron Village
address: 432 Woodburn Rd, Raleigh, NC 27605, USA
reviews:
This spot is truly a gem! My husband and I were going to dinner this past Saturday and wanted to try a new restaurant. I found this restaurant on Yelp and when we drove here and realized it's in a strip mall, I honestly didn't know what to expect. (Not that it makes a difference, but it looked small on the outside so I assumed a wait). The restaurant is a lot larger than it appears. The string lights on the outside flow into the restaurant on the inside.
The host greeted us and told us it would be about twenty minutes but really, it was less than ten. We were seated near the kitchen which was fun to be able and look inside while watching orders come out. Our waitress helped me narrow down which cocktail I wanted and I settled for the 'Ladybird' which didn't disappoint. We skipped appetizers since we weren't too hungry and each got an entree. I opted for the margarita pizza and my husband got the shrimp tacos with the green rice as a side. Everything tasted great and was very good. The overall vibe of the restaurant was enjoyable and each table had enough space between so you don't feel squished. I am happy that we tried Tazza and we will be back very soon!

Took a while to get a seat, so definitely recommend reservations if you go on a Sunday morning. Food was amazing! Service was good even though they were packed. Portions are large. I couldn’t finish my French toast. Coffee was delicious too! Only complaint was the wait.

Fun food good service. Pleasant and interesting building. Crab cakes are worth the visit alone. All the seafood was good and the table next to us raved about the tacos and burger. Clean and comfortable.

A nice locally owned place to order a fantastic pizza. They have all the normal Italian staples. They have an awesome pizza selection. I ordered a Spicy Sausage and Black Pepper Honey pizza and it was incredible. The service was great and friendly. Prices were about normal, about $10-15 per person.

I was very impressed with this restaurant. The atmosphere was cozy, the staff was friendly, and the food was tasty. We tried the brisket tacos, carnitas tacos, and the spicy sausage and black pepper honey pizza. Wasn't disappointed with anything. I would come back for sure.

name: Mecca Restaurant
address: 13 E Martin St, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: I'm glad this place is still going strong after all these years. I love the "diner classics menu" but I wish they still served breakfast all day. Now they just serve breakfast for Sunday brunch. Under new owners, they now have evening hours, & serve alcohol. Prices have gone up. $25 is too much for a diner lunch for 2!
Best fried chicken in Raleigh. And boy do they give you a lot of it. Plenty to share!

One of the best old school restaurants in Raleigh.  Food has been constantly good for the last 20 years I have been going there.  Their Cheese Burger is perfect.  Meat and 2 for lunch.  Never disappoints.

Mecca serves delicious, Southern-style diner fare with a warm and friendly atmosphere. We love bringing guests to this historic location and featuring tastings from Mecca as part our Raleigh Walking Food Tour.
Been in business for 90 years. It shows. Great food and a great price. Wonderful staff to boot. The building is awesome and they have an old ham. Go and see it for yourself

name: The Point At Glenwood Restaurant and Bar
address: 1626 Glenwood Ave, Raleigh, NC 27608, USA
reviews: Impromptu dinner visit on a Monday night had all 3 of us pleasantly surprised as first time guest. Would recommend it and would gladly return.

My husband's food when it arrived was hot while mine was not.  We love coming to The Point to dine but this time we were not quite as impressed with the food as we have in the past.  Our server K was exceptionally terrific as all your staff has always be friendly.  We will continue to visit but I believe feedback is always welcome.
Amazing environment in Raleigh’s historical five points. A staple. Amazing food and drinks and support staff. Highly suggest dinner and Sunday brunch buffet. Can handle large parties with ease!
The Perfect Lunch. Pizza, Soup And Salad! Love this place..
It was good. Food was seasoned perfectly and it was cooked well. A blackened grilled chicken of some sort lol. Bartender was nice too. It was cold as Ice in there so thank God I brought my jacket.

name: Cafe Tiramisu
address: 6008 Falls of Neuse Rd, Raleigh, NC 27609, USA
reviews: Lovely dinner at the bar last night.  Attentive waiter/bartender.  Servings are ample.  Nice wines by the glass.  Well seasoned food.  Pasta is cooked just right.  Can't wait to return to try other dishes.  Very much recommend.

I have been wanting to try Cafe Tiramisu for a long time. I've heard and read so many good things about it. I finally got the opportunity to have dinner here, and I can see why so many people love this place. Service by far was the highlight. Very friendly, and welcoming. My entree selection, the Chicken Marscapone, was just wonderful. So decadent, and balanced with the spinach fettuccine alfredo. I normally am unable to finish my pasta at most Italian restaurants, but this dish changed that! The wine we chose was also excellent. In contrast, the cocktail menu could use some work. The two selections we chose from the list didn't seem to fit with the time of year, and was a little on the overly sweet side. Also, the small caesar salad I had to start the meal, was surprisingly bland. I'm hoping the more interesting sounding entree size salads are more exciting. That all said, it was a superb meal. I would highly recommend this place for anyone looking for good Italian food in the triangle area, especially for a date. Don't let the Harris Teeter shopping center fool you, It's legit! First Time Diners: Make your reservations early, as this place is on the smaller side.
Chilean seabass, tomatoes, spinach, capers, parmesan white wine reduction sauce with homemade spinach fettuccine... highly recommend!

Excellent.. Best Italian cuisine in Raleigh. Service is top notch. Intimate dining experience that impresses every time. Recommend making a reservation, but will accommodate if possible. Thank you Cafe Tiramisu! And RD!!
I ordered take out tonight. Excellent food! The shrimp and scallops pasta, clam linguine and tiramisu wonderful! Thanks!

name: Margaux's Restaurant
address: 8111 Creedmoor Rd, Raleigh, NC 27613, USA
reviews:
The angel hair pasta with shrimp was probably the best pasta plate I've had in a while. 
Generous portion sizes at a reasonable price.
Our server was attentive and fun! 
The restaurant has a cozy, dark feel about it.
Definitely recommend for a date night, or to impress out of town family.

My party of four Tried the Three course dinner each: all were promptly served and the right portions from appetizers to dessert! Great decor, friendly staff and comfortable.  Ample parking.  Highly recommended

Food was fantastic. From the appetizer thru dessert. Service was very good. Atmosphere was just right. We enjoyed the 3 course meal and I would certainly recommend it. Never felt rushed. A delightful experience. This is my 1st five star in almost 2 years.

During this very difficult time we ordered our favorite comfort food to go. The owner Steve who knows us very well said no problem and his team had our meal prepared as quickly and as appetizing as dining in. We  support our favorite restaurant in Raleigh and hope that you will too through and beyond this crisis. Thanks Steve!
Carol and Russell

Have been here before and especially enjoyed their weekday specials.  This Saturday night we were lucky enough to be invited to a private dinner and it was phenomenal.  Stephanie and Trey took the BEST care of us from appetizers to dessert.  I love that the Chef knows how to kick up flavors.  The appetizers we had were all amazing.  Our group also enjoyed soup or salad, exceptional entrees and fantastic desserts.

My Cornmeal Crusted Grouper with Hoppin' John, Local Collards, Red Bliss Mash and House Hot Sauce was so good and plentiful that I can't wait for leftovers.  Meanwhile others were happy with their entrees.  Many got the Filet and it was perfectly cooked.  Yum also for the Key Lime Pie, Bailey's Cheesecake and Profiterole desserts!

TIP:  Monday nights they have a special deal all night, then other weekdays look for their early bird specials!  

This place is great for date-night because you can actually hear what someone is saying, and they take such good care of you!

name: Bahama Breeze - Curbside To Go & Delivery
address: 3309 Wake Forest Rd, Raleigh, NC 27609, USA
reviews: Our reservations were honored swiftly. Very nice atmosphere. For some reason the lights blinked on and off four times during our dinner visit which was alarming. The food was absolutely delicious. However, the portions were small for the pricing in my opinion. Our server was amazing.

The food was really good. I'm Caribbean, and my mom is one of those who would rather cook than eat out but she was visiting, and she loved the flavors, preparations, and service! I've already recommended this spot to my siblings, and I'll definitely be doing back. Nonetheless, it's super comfortable. I'd say casual attire. I wore heels and didn't feel overdressed.

Really good food, second time on this chain, first time in this location. I was really satisfied. This location has an "outdoors indoors" which they offered to sit by the fireplace, and it's really nice, but the cold from outside still leaks in very well, so one side was chilly and the other was somewhat warm from the fire.
I had an amazing server, he was on top of his job, not too intrusive either. Before going there, everyone said the service sucks, but I loved it.
Keep in mind I wasn't there in the busy hours.

The food is wonderful, the portion sizes are generous. The atmosphere feels like you are in an Island cafe', just without the sand. The service is kind and thoughtful. There are a large number of seafood and vegan options. There are also great desserts, and  generous portions... !!!!

So I have been here before and let me say... The food is almost always amazing. The staff is usually very good too. My last visit had an unexpected visitor but the manager was quick to acknowledge the situation and comp my meal as a way to help rectify it. I will go back, but not anytime soon. Some might not think it is fair to hold them responsible for an unexpected visitor, but I can't help it. Sorry.

name: Hummingbird
address: 1053 E Whitaker Mill Rd STE 111, Raleigh, NC 27604, USA
reviews: First time dining at Hummingbird. Friends and I went for brunch and they had a quality menu. Service was quick and easy. Only downside was a few people at my table requested gluten free bread and they came back to say they were all out. They did accommodate them but their meals were not as enjoyable because of that. I’d go back however, despite that. Chicken and waffles were great.

Great place with a friendly staff.  The food was superb.  Although this was our first visit.......I believe our choices were great.....so here goes.  My wife started with the Hummingbird Fizz signature drink.....and I had an amber lager.  We tried two small plates to share, the wings and fall salad....both were phenomenal.   We then ordered dinner...I had the pork cheeks which were five or six incredibly tender pieces of meat over potatoes and broccolii (steamed) over the top.  My wife had the chicken......and she was able to finish half (the rest will be for lunch tomorrow).  We also had the charred cabbage which really was unique and very tasty.  We'll be back.

Wanted to grab some good and quick!!!! My first time eating but as soon as I saw my favorite waitress from another favorite spot, I knew the food here would be great!!! She suggested the avocado toast with a fried medium over well egg and this spicy peanut sala!!!!!! I paired it with a drink made from wild flowers and raw honey and finished my meal with a sticky bun with sea salt and caramel!!! SOOO FREAKING DELICIOUS!!!!!! 🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤🤤

The food was gorgeous and wonderful - I had a salad with chicory - and so were the drinks. I had something grapefruit, I think, garnished with rosemary. I loved it. This place nails all the greatest details - heavy silver, paper straws, cloth napkins and cloth towels. In addition, the décor is, like, this beautifully sophisticated mix of traditional, rustic, industrial, MCM and, like, normal elements. The whole experience ends up just being a joy - cozy and chic. The service was unbeatable
Hummingbird is heaven, it feels familiar and friendly. The food is always unique and delicious. #fawnfeasts on ig

name: Capri Restaurant
address: 6325 Falls of Neuse Rd, Raleigh, NC 27609, USA
reviews: Dino always has a friendly welcome, a warm smile, and excellent food. His support of Veterans is unmatched.

One of the best keep secrets in the area. I am very picky with Italian food but this was by far some of the best Italian food I have had in a long time. The chef will make anything you like even if its not on the menu. The gnocchi, calamari, and fried veal was delicious. The desert was the icing on the cake. This is a must go!!!! It will not disappoint!!

Wonderful restaurant! The owner Dino makes the dining experience super special! My family went for Sunday dinner but you could easily enjoy this place for a date night or celebration dinner! The food was very authentic! The Tiramisu and ice cream were both delicious! I recommend this place!
Great Northern Italian food. Family owned, best Tiramisu I have ever had.
This place is great! The food and decor were spot on. No complaints, but this restaurant is just in a super unfortunate location. It deserves a lot more traffic than it gets.

name: CO
address: 101 Park at N Hills St, Raleigh, NC 27609, USA
reviews:
One of the better restaurants that has a good selection of Gluten free and Vegan options in the Raleigh area.

Overall great food with a mild taste that will satisfy even the most discerning local critics.  Value was spot on and the vibe was hip enough but not too much ‘in your face’.  

Tried two types of Summer rolls for starters, both were excellent and mild.  Sauce was the excellent complexity that added just the right kick at the end.  If you need heat, there are house sauces that will suit you need for speed.  

Hibachi Deluxe was next with a tofu lemon grass piece that had a beautiful layer that was excellent and fresh.  The vegetable medley was soft with a little crunch, just right with beautiful colors of reds and greens.  

Filling meal, dessert was too much for us.  I could possibly see an addictive trend starting with the excellent food and service.  Wonderful meal.  Definitely worth a two hour drive for a great experience in the city of Raleigh.

This place, is an amazing restaurant! There dishes are delicious, authentic, and just all around amazing. Its across from the Capital Grill, which is another amazing restaurant. There is parking across the street from Co, so you wont have to walk far! If your looking for a good place to eat in North Hills, and your looking for something different, I highly reccomend this place!

Incredible food, friendly and attentive staff, and an elevated casual atmosphere.
We split the pre fixe menu (tuna taco, half sushi roll, hibachi tofu, and strawberry spring roll) and added edamame gyoza, ahi poke stack, and mango summer roll.
The food came out with great timing, and was beautifully presented to the finest detail. Better gyoza than we've found in dumpling houses, the raw tuna was superb and not at all fishy, the hibachi was the first hibachi I've /ever/ enjoyed (well-seasoned, crisp tofu, not too salty, great sauces) and the strawberry spring rolls were a shocking, magical experience.
We'd give it more stars if possible!

Excellent service and incredible food! It was a perfect date night spot! We ordered three entrees and a small dish and it was half-off a bottle of wine night, so we got a French red wine with a name I can't remember or pronounce. Definitely coming back!

I am giving it a 5 stars for so many reasons. My boyfriend and I went on a little getaway from Charlotte. We were undecided what we wanted to eat so we came to CO. We started with some Spring Rolls appetizer. OMG I really recommend them. Especially if you like healthy food. I just think they need to put a little bit of more meat. Well it was time to order our food and like always my boyfriend didn't know what to get. It was either Poke or Hibachi Bowl. Without asking the server she (Asian short lady)was kind enough to explain what was the difference. Basically Poke is a Hot/Cold plate while the Hibachi is a hot one. He decided to go with the Hibachi which I recommend. I got myself Com Chein. This plate was so delicious. It was rice with chicken, shrimp, carrots & edamame. I had a whiskey sour which I'm very hard to get pleased with the drinks down here since I'm from NY. I was in Heaven with my drink. I will definitely go to this restaurant again!

name: Jose and Sons Bar and Kitchen
address: 327 W Davie St #102, Raleigh, NC 27601, USA
reviews: The experience was a delight all the way through. The music was light and cried noise minimal. Understated and appropriate decor. Friendly and prompt wait staff. It's restaurant week so I had the lunch 3 course special. Brisket flautas, the Raleigh burrito and flan. Each was plated well and the flavors were fresh and tantalizing. This is a place to revisit for me.
Not super happy with the Sunday Brunch menu. It feels like it's been trimmed down and not really standing out. The menu used to have several favorites that are now gone.

Fantastic option for corporate catering! We ordered from Jose & Sons for our companywide meeting in Cary on October 4, 2019 (National Taco Day)! The food, portions, and service were all fantastic. Mike, our catering manager, was very responsive and helpful with menu suggestions. Delivery was on time and everyone loved the food. I would highly recommend Jose & Sons for your office catering.

A very cool place for good Mexican food. The burrito I had was awesome. As well as the brisket tacito app and flan dessert (all part of Triangle Restaurant Week menu). Great portions and friendly service. I'll definitely be back to try out the rest of the menu.

Absolutely delicious plates. Reasonable prices. A fun mix of Mexican food + Southern, very well executed. Highly recommend if visiting Raleigh.
And you can make reservations in advance online.
